Title: Data Analyst (Payment, Fintech)
Description:
As the world‚Äôs pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe‚Äôs largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

Job Description

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (Payment) to join the Fintech team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of building the financial backbone of Delivery Hero. You‚Äôll develop products that empower millions of customers and merchants, from seamless payments to innovative financial solutions like wallets and credit. Your work will support our path to profitability by creating financial flexibility for users and enabling smooth transactions across 70+ countries.

In this role you will:


Partner closely with Fintech Business and Product stakeholders to understand their analytical needs, and execute the roadmap for analytics work for Payment Analytics
Develop and optimize monitoring tools, perform deep-dive analysis and provide insights to facilitate a data-driven decision making
Exploit and analyze high volumes of data in order to quantify and answer questions to improve the business performance. Monitor KPIs, identify user behavior patterns and actively take actions to improve online payment performance across multiple regions
Demonstrate proficiency in coding practices and analytic approaches
Be able to answer the 'What?' question effectively and within reasonable deadlines, but also think about the 'So What?' and 'Now What' portions of the analysis
Proactively bring new ideas and suggestions to the team and our internal clients to improve our Fintech set up


Qualifications


You have worked as a data analyst and delivered measurable impact on improving understanding of payments
You have proven experience with daily practice of SQL, and visualization tools such as Tableau, and Looker
You have experience working with online payments and deep knowledge of the PSP, issuer, acquirer, and card scheme data.
You are eager on making business impact through analytics and you understand the product lifecycle
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills
You demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills


Nice To Have:


Experience with BigQuery, Airflow, and Python
Understanding of real-time data analytics
Good understanding of mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models


Additional Information

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you‚Äôre in good shape, then we‚Äôre in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 ‚Ç¨ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we‚Äôll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.




Ready to join our team? If you‚Äôre excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world‚Äôs leading delivery platform, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience‚Äîjust include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
You're not just looking for a new role ‚Äî you want to build data infrastructure that directly improves customer outcomes. As our first Customer Success hire with a data focus, you'll be the bridge between raw customer data and actionable insights. You'll take ownership of extracting, cleaning, and structuring complex datasets from various sources to support seamless onboarding, usage monitoring, and value delivery. Using Python and analytics tools, you'll turn messy data into clear signals ‚Äî enabling smarter customer engagement and scalable success processes. Your work will define how we operationalize Customer Success and set the foundation for long-term customer impact.

Key Responsibilities üéØ


Own technical onboarding - Own the full data setup for new customers, including extraction, ETL, and integration of formats like CSV, JSON, XML, and geodata (e.g. KML, SHP)
Build scalable data workflows - Use AI tools & Python to automate key processes
Bridge tech and customer needs - Translate operational and IT requirements into smooth integrations, including with systems like SAP or GIS-systems
Communicate with clarity - Build trust across all levels by pairing technical expertise with strong, empathetic communication



This role is right for you if... ‚ú®


You're a tech-savvy problem solver who thrives on turning messy data into clean, usable formats
You're comfortable writing scripts, building data pipelines, and navigating complex file formats and APIs
You enjoy working directly with customers ‚Äî not just to support them, but to deeply understand their technical constraints and solve them collaboratively
You love structure, automation, and scalable solutions ‚Äî and constantly seek to use newest AI tools
You're self-driven, curious, and excited to take full ownership of implementation and data integration projects
You are motivated by the opportunity to make a positive impact on the planet üåç



Requirements


Skills & experience you will need üí™


Prior experience in a technical customer-facing role like in consulting
Hands-on experience with data conversion, ETL pipelines and strong Excel skills
Solid Python scripting skills for automation and data transformation
Experience with AI tools to accelerate workflows
Fluent in both English and German



Nice-to-haves üçí


Experience with geospatial data formats like KML or SHP
Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating datasets
Familiarity with enterprise systems like SAP and GIS-systems and in managing enterprise stakeholders



Benefits


Remote Working: Work from our hubs in Hamburg or Munich, or remote from Germany
Unlimited Vacation: Take as many holidays as you need ‚Äî we trust you to recharge when it matters most
Flexible Working Hours: Work during the hours that align with your peak performance and lifestyle
Mental Health Matters: Access 1:1 psychologist sessions and workshops through our Bloom partnership
Professional Growth: Use a dedicated development budget to enhance your skills and career
Stock Option Plan: Receive virtual stocks as a reward for your trust, effort, and vision alignment
Unite, Recharge, Celebrate: Join in-person team retreats to connect and have fun
Explore Germany: Enjoy the Deutschlandticket for flexible public transportation access
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Lion Studios

Lion Studios is a mobile games publisher that works with mobile developers to get their games discovered by players around the world. Headquartered in San Francisco, Lion Studios‚Äô creative and strategy teams utilize their expertise to help game developers break through the noise and grow their businesses. Since launching in 2018, Lion Studios has driven 90% of its games to the Top 10 in the App Store and Google Play and helped drive 16 games to #1 in the US App Store‚Äôs Top Free chart. Many of the studio‚Äôs games hit the top 10 and the top 20 across both the App Store and Google Play. Collectively, the studio has driven hundreds of millions of downloads. Check out some of our hit releases: Mr. Bullet, Happy Glass, Save the Girl, and Slap Kings.

Lion Studios is looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Product Scientist / Data Analyst to lead experimentation and A/B testing efforts across our diverse mobile games portfolio. In this role, you'll design, execute, and analyze experiments that inform critical product decisions ‚Äî from game mechanics and monetization strategies to LiveOps features and UX improvements.

A Day in the Life

You‚Äôll work closely with product managers, game designers, and data engineers to ensure our decisions are grounded in rigorous analysis and statistically sound experimentation.

The Impact You‚Äôll Make:


Translating business requirements into technical implementations via instrumentation in games to collect necessary data
Design and manage A/B tests across multiple titles, ensuring tests are well-structured, statistically valid, and actionable.
Define success metrics and analytical frameworks to evaluate core gameplay, monetization, and retention experiments.
Build dashboards and reports that communicate key experiment outcomes and product insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with product teams to develop hypotheses and provide data-driven recommendations.
Work with data engineering to ensure proper event tracking and data reliability.
Drive the experimentation roadmap across the portfolio to foster a culture of rapid iteration and continuous learning.


Required Qualifications:


2 - 4 years of professional experience. Specific experience with social games, mobile apps, and/or cognitive sciences is strongly preferred.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field. Honors thesis or Master‚Äôs degree with thesis is strongly preferred.
Experience designing, running and evaluating quantitative experiments
Proficient with R and/or Python for data modeling and analysis
Proficient with SQL
Ability to be self-sufficient and execute quickly when given autonomy
Flexible team player who will thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving environment
Excellent English and communication skills


Preferred Qualifications:


Previous experience in mobile gaming, especially with free-to-play or hybrid casual games.
Familiarity with user segmentation, cohort analysis, and predictive mo


AppLovin has become aware of a scam targeting jobseekers with fake ‚Äúapp optimization‚Äù and similar roles. We do not ask our candidates to download apps or make any form of payment(s). AppLovin works with applicants through our Careers page and applovin.com email addresses. If you are contacted through other unofficial channels (such as WhatsApp or Telegram) or asked to download an app or make a payment, these contacts are not legitimate. Confirm the information here and contact us directly with any questions.

Lion Studios is an AppLovin Studio. AppLovin makes technologies that help businesses of every size connect to their ideal customers. The company provides end-to-end software and AI solutions for businesses to reach, monetize and grow their global audiences. For more information about AppLovin, visit: www.applovin.com.

To deliver on this mission, our global team is composed of team members with life experiences, backgrounds, and perspectives that mirror our developers and customers around the world. At AppLovin, we are intentional about the team and culture we are building, seeking candidates who are outstanding in their own right and also demonstrate their support of others.

Fortune recognized AppLovin as one of the Best Workplaces in the Bay Area 2022, and is a Certified Great Place to Work in 2021, 2022 and 2023. Check out the rest of our awards HERE.

AppLovin is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or other legally protected characteristics. Learn more about EEO rights as an applicant here.

If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or recruiting process, please send us a request at accommodations@applovin.com.

AppLovin will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. If you‚Äôre applying for a position in California, learn more here.

Please read our Global Applicant Privacy Notice to learn more about how AppLovin processes your personal information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bank of London

Bank of London offers a safer business banking model by holding all deposits at the Bank of England, eliminating the risk of 'bank runs.' It provides services such as Deposit-as-a-Service (DaaS), Embedded Banking, real-timeClearing, Payments, and Settlement, as well as Commercial Banking tailored to businesses. Powered by proprietary technology, the bank collaborates with SAP Fioneer to deliver innovative solutions. With a focus on exceptional service and core values of compassion, ownership, and curiosity, the bank strives for excellence in all it does.

Requirements

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Analyst to oversee our organisation's data reporting, analysis, and visualisation efforts. The ideal candidate will possess advanced Power BI expertise with a track record of automation within a regulated environment.

This role is pivotal in driving data-driven decision-making across the business by ensuring the delivery of insightful, accurate, and timely management information.

You will be applying your advanced analytical skills, across complex data, commercial and product scenarios, guiding strategy, planning and operational activities. Your responsibility for delivery of management information, will be invaluable for equipping our teams with game changing insights.

You will play a critical role in design and production of Management Information (MI). You will engage and collaborate with colleagues, communicating your researched insights in order to drive individuals, teams and projects in their actions.

Lead the MI function, ensuring data integrity, accuracy and timeliness of reports
Drive the automation agenda, removing manual processes and building scalable MI solutions as a foundation for growth
Respond to ad-hoc data requests from colleagues
Prioritisation of regular and ad hoc reporting to satisfy external and internal stakeholders
Maintain the integrity of the MI Process with detailed review and data cleansing to ensure all data and reports are accurate, current, complete and consistent
Continuously review and improve MI processes to enhance efficiency, accuracy and relevance of reporting

Responsibilities

You will have an eye for detail which is second to none and be keen to keep learning in a tech savvy environment. You will be able to communicate the relevance and importance of your data insights, guiding colleagues towards achieving exceptional outcomes.

Data Visualisation: Expertise in creating interactive dashboards and reports in Power BI. (Essential)
SQL Proficiency: Strong ability to write and optimise SQL queries for data extraction and analysis. (Essential)
Data Warehousing: Experience with Snowflake for data storage and management. (Preferred)
Data Analysis: Advanced analytical skills to interpret data and provide actionable insights
DirectQuery & ETL: Experience working with DirectQuery mode and designing efficient ETL processes. (Preferred)
Stakeholder Engagement: Ability to translate technical concepts into insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Proven track record of prioritising and managing department objectives.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to deliver a high level of accuracy in the role
Have the ability to organise and prioritise workloads to ensure business critical work is completed
At least two years experience working with Power BI
A good team player who can also work from own initiative especially with data

Location

London or Belfast (5 or 4 days per week in the office).

Travel to other locations may be required on occasion.

Diversity

Bank of London is an equal opportunity employer committed to inclusion, diversity and belonging. All qualified applicants are welcome and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion or religious expression, sex, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity and expression, transgender, national origin, or military veteran status.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
üöÄ We're hiring: Data Analytics Engineer

üìç London (Hybrid ‚Äì 3 days in office) | üí∞ + Bonus + 12% Flex Benefits




I'm working with a global fintech scale-up on a mission to reimagine how people trade and invest. With hundreds of thousands of users worldwide and a strong presence across 18 countries, we‚Äôre looking for someone who can help harness the power of data to fuel smarter marketing decisions.




This is a high-impact role for someone who loves owning the full analytics engineering process from tracking and modelling through to dashboarding and strategic insight.

üß† What you'll be doing:

Designing and maintaining data pipelines for marketing data sources
Building and optimising models for marketing analytics and attribution
Creating tracking frameworks and event schemas for performance marketing
Developing self-serve dashboards and reporting systems
Supporting campaign analysis, marketing performance reviews and ad hoc insights
Ensuring data quality, accessibility and governance with the help of our data engineering team

üõ†Ô∏è What we‚Äôre looking for:

Experience in analytics engineering, BI, or a related role
Strong SQL and data modelling skills
Hands-on with modern BI tools like Looker or Tableau
Understanding of ETL processes and marketing data flows
Familiarity with attribution models and marketing metrics
Experience working with version control and modern data stack tech

üéÅ What‚Äôs in it for you?

Competitive salary + performance-based bonus
12% flexible benefits package
Generous pension and private medical insurance
Career development support incl. access to LinkedIn Learning
Two volunteering days + your birthday off

Job Description

Company overview

Marken, UPS Healthcare Precision Logistics (formerly Marken, MNX & Polar Speed), the clinical and advanced therapy subsidiary of UPS Healthcare, unites expertise across healthcare and complex secure logistics to drive the success of our clients through innovation.

Job Purpose

To support the Billing Automation team with global reporting, analysis and data management.

Key member of the Billing Automation team to work with Billing leads.
Analysing large quantity of financial data via PowerBI and Excel reports.
Maximising and leveraging the existing BI reporting tools to support the Billing Automation activities.

Working alongside teams including BI, Ops and Pricing.

People person, Self-starter, Inquisitive.
Potential is more important than experience.
BI experience.

Strong analytical skills.
Excellent communication and influencing skills.
Enjoy the challenge of analysing large/complex datasets to produce insights.
Ability to manage multiple priorities to complete assignments in a timely manner and work to deadlines.

Permanent

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client, a big player in Luxembourg's logistics and transportation market is looking for motivated and solution-oriented Data Analyst to enhance their analytical and decision-support capabilities, with a specific focus on the monitoring and optimization of our vehicle fleet.




Tasks and Responsibilities:

Maintaining, enhancing, and developing Qlik Sense dashboards related to telematics, KPIs, and operational performance.
Understanding the needs of non-technical end users and designing reports that are intuitive, relevant, and user-friendly.
Structuring, cleaning, and modeling data from various sources, particularly from telematics systems and internal tools.
Writing and optimizing SQL queries to support data visualizations and analyses.
Acting as a proactive point of contact for internal departments, delivering data-driven insights that add measurable value.
Identifying and proposing improvements to existing tools and processes, contributing to their implementation.
Providing analytical input primarily for telematics management, while remaining open to supporting other business domains.




Your Profile:

Bachelor's degree in Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, IT, or equivalent experience.
Degrees in logic-based disciplines (e.g., industrial engineering) combined with a strong interest in data analytics are also welcome.
Solid working knowledge of SQL.
Experience with or strong interest in Business Intelligence tools; Qlik Sense is a significant asset.
Understanding of interconnected data systems (ERP, telematics platforms, external databases, etc.).
Proactive, autonomous, and highly organized.
Resourceful and solution-driven, with a strong ability to investigate and resolve issues.
Excellent communication and listening skills, with the ability to translate business needs into effective reports.
Strong analytical thinking, with a knack for simplifying complex data.
Curious and continuously seeking to learn and improve tools and processes.




Ready to take the next step in your career? Visit our website at www.select-jobs.lu to learn more about our open roles!

Title: Freelance Data Analyst (Python) - AI Trainer
Description:
At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Data Analysis, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Triple-check some delivery data and ensure client expectations are reflected in every batch
Generate prompts that challenge AI
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge
Ensure taxonomies are logical, consistent, and aligned with operational needs



How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, Mathematics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analysis
You have experience with prompt engineering (basic to intermediate level) and have Basic-to-Intermediate Python Scripting and SQL understanding
You are proficient in spreadsheet tools such as Google Sheets, Excel
You have experience with interpreting data visualization & reporting (e.g., dashboards)
You have a strong command of taxonomy and classification design
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge



Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Returns, ReCommerce & Sustainability
Description:
Description

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join the Reverse Logistics Services team to help unlock insights which take our team to the next level. The ideal candidate will be excited about understanding and implementing new and repeatable processes, while providing data to improve the Returns transportation business. The successful candidate will have strong data mining and modeling skills and is comfortable facilitating ideas and working from concept through to execution. They will partner with various key stakeholders to deep dive into the business challenges and data to identify insights, providing recommendations for process improvement on a globally scalable level. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as strong business acumen.

Key job responsibilities


Retrieving and analyzing data using Excel, SQL, and other data management systems
Monitoring existing metrics, analyzing data and partnering with internal/external teams to identify process and system improvement opportunities
Design, develop and maintain scalable, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, or dashboards to enable stakeholders to manage the business and drive effective decisions
Prepare and deliver business requirements reviews to leadership teams
Excellent writing skills, to create artifacts easily digestible by business and tech partners.
Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data


About The Team

At Amazon Worldwide Returns & ReCommerce (WW R&R), we aspire to zero: zero cost of returns, zero waste, and zero defects.

We are an agile, innovative organization dedicated to ‚Äòmaking zero happen‚Äô to benefit our customers, company, and environment. We are constantly innovating to create long-term value at Amazon by investing in the future and focusing on the planet, not just on the bottom line. WW R&R includes business, product, program, operational, data, and software engineering teams, who together manage the lifecycle of returned and damaged products.

Basic Qualifications


Experience in Transportation or Operations
Experience managing and influencing key metrics
Ability to analyze associate and customer inputs to influence internal and external partners
Experience with MS Outlook, Excel, and Word
Strong written communications skills
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau and/or experience with SQL & Quicksight


Preferred Qualifications


2+ years experience in Transportation or Operations
Experience with transportation safety processes
Customer returns transportation or operations experience
Strong background in administrative support, project or data management and working with tech teams


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Job ID: A2906512

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Team spirit and initiative are your most prominent strengths, and you are motivated to develop a long-term career in Intellectual Property, in a multicultural work environment? Apply now!

Your Responsibilities


Extract, clean, and transform data from multiple sources (e.g., SQL databases, Excel files)
Transform collected data into clear, actionable insights through structured analysis and easily interpretable formats
Write queries and develop periodical reports using SQL, Python and Power BI
Support the development and maintenance of automated data pipelines and reporting processes
Manage day-to-day operational data requests like client information, financial data, product and service information
Maintain a web portal, an automatic report system, and Power BI dashboards
Collaborate with business units, product managers, and engineers to translate business requirements into analytical solutions
Mentor junior analysts and contribute to developing analytics best practices within the team
Analyze and document existing reports, providing strategic recommendations to management for enhancements and optimization
Bring your ideas to improve the products or the processes
Learn the business of Intellectual Property



Your Profile


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or related field
Minimum 4 years of experience in a similar position
Experience with data querying with SQL, Microsoft SQL server management.
Proficient in Python for development
Solid understanding in visualization tools (e.g. Power BI)
Knowledge of version control. Git with Microsoft Azure DevOps is an asset
Self-organized and creative team player with effective communication skills
Excellent time management, self-organized, solution-focused and keen attention to detail
Fluency in English is mandatory; German and/or French is considered as an asset



Join and grow with us!


Develop and customize your long-time career within a fast growing multinational company.
Enjoy working in multicultural teams and contribute to a diverse and international working environment.
Organize your lifestyle with flexible working hours.
Take the opportunity to act independently and entrepreneurial in your area of responsibility and profit from flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes.
Celebrate success together as one team at our various corporate events.
Attend a tailor-made onboarding program as well as individual training & development opportunities.
Contribute through your personality and your daily work to make an impact on our business, corporate culture, society and environment.

Title: Data Analyst / Statistician (Category II)
Description:
NTU International A/S is leading a consortium for the preparation of proposal for the EU funded project in SEA Lot 6: Education Sector Public Expenditure Review (PER) in Greenland and is searching for non-key experts to support the core team during the implementation of this project.

The overall objective of the Education PER would be to provide evidence-based recommendations for: better fiscal management, efficiently and effectively use of public expenditures to support Greenland‚Äôs education sector, improve service delivery).




Data Analyst / Statistician (Category II)




Key Responsibilities:

Conduct in-depth analysis of budget execution, fiscal policies, and financial oversight mechanisms.
Analyze large and complex datasets to identify trends in public spending and financial performance.
Conduct variance analysis and support cost-benefit and cost-effectiveness assessments.
Ensure data quality, accuracy, and integrity across various sources.
Develop compelling data visualizations, dashboards, and presentations for technical and non-technical audiences.
Collaborate with finance, education, and policy experts to support integrated analytical outputs.
Contribute to the design and implementation of data collection strategies where needed.
Prepare analytical reports, briefs, and data summaries for stakeholders and decision-makers.




‚òùÔ∏è Qualifications and skills:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in English (C1); Knowledge of Danish or Greenlandic is an asset.

‚òùÔ∏è Professional experience:

Minimum of 7 years of relevant professional experience, with demonstrated expertise in data analysis, preferably in public finance, economics, or development sectors.
Advanced proficiency in statistical software and data visualization tools (e.g., R, Python, STATA, SPSS, Tableau, Power BI).
Proven experience in handling large datasets and applying advanced statistical techniques.
Strong knowledge of public sector data, fiscal indicators, or development finance is a plus.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present complex data in accessible formats.




‚òùÔ∏è Preferred Qualifications:

Experience working with government, development agencies, or international institutions.
Familiarity with open data standards, GIS, or machine learning tools is a plus.
Publication or authorship of relevant analytical reports or dashboards.




If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

‚òùÔ∏è Qualifications and skills:

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Statistics, Data Science, Economics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
  • Proficiency in English (C1); Knowledge of Danish or Greenlandic is an asset.

‚òùÔ∏è Professional experience:

  • Minimum of 7 years of relevant professional experience, with demonstrated expertise in data analysis, preferably in public finance, economics, or development sectors.
  • Advanced proficiency in statistical software and data visualization tools (e.g., R, Python, STATA, SPSS, Tableau, Power BI).
  • Proven experience in handling large datasets and applying advanced statistical techniques.
  • Strong knowledge of public sector data, fiscal indicators, or development finance is a plus.
  • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present complex data in accessible formats.


‚òùÔ∏è Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with government, development agencies, or international institutions.
  • Familiarity with open data standards, GIS, or machine learning tools is a plus.
  • Publication or authorship of relevant analytical reports or dashboards.


If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply and upload your CV via LinkedIn or sent to recruitment@ntu.eu. Due to the large number of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Management, Data Analyst
Company: Revantage Europe, A Blackstone Portfolio Company
Description:
Overview

Who we ‚ÄúR‚Äù

Revantage Europe is a professional corporate services company that embraces ambition and innovation to service Blackstone‚Äôs European real estate investments.

Blackstone is the world‚Äôs largest alternative asset manager, with a real estate portfolio that includes industrial & logistics, residential, office, hospitality and retail properties in North America, Europe, Asia, Australia and New Zealand.

What We Value - Our Culture

Creating a culture that inspires change and momentum requires the right team. We know what it takes to lead an industry, and are looking for leaders who seek constant growth, want to excel, and continuously improve upon themselves and the industry. The culture at Revantage is built on our shared core values and commitment to be:


Achievers: We expect high standards for ourselves and enable the success of our teams.
Enthusiasts: We face challenges with optimism and believe anything is possible.
Leaders: We commit to continuously improve our performance.
Learners: We learn from our challenges, successes and the diversity of our people.
Partners: We deliver value and positive impact to our partners.



Why This Role Is Valuable

The role serves as a bridge between raw data and actionable business insights. Applies tools and techniques for business analysis to summarise and present insights in the most appropriate format. Expected to effectively communicate with management and stakeholders, aiding them in comprehending business needs, identifying pain points and inefficiencies, and leveraging data for strategic business decisions.

Responsibilities


Collaborate with Revantage and Blackstone teams to identify data-related opportunities and challenges, and provide recommendations for process improvements and innovations
Conduct ad hoc data analyses to address specific business inquiries and provide actionable insights promptly
Work closely with business teams and data engineers and scientists to ensure data flows seamlessly from various sources and assist in implementing sophisticated data analyses
Write queries to extract data from warehouses, implement views for business consumption;
Assisting with the preparation of dashboards and report building
Create appropriate documentation that allows stakeholders to understand the steps of data analysis process and replicate the analysis if necessary



Qualifications

What You Bring To The Role


At least a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Accounting, Engineering or related field
2+ years of professional data experience
Strong SQL skills (mandatory) with preferably some Python experience (2+ years)
Familiarity with data visualization and business intelligence tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau)
Skills in conducting requirements and process analyses
Knowledgeable or willingness to learn data management and governance practices and principles
Ideally have a background in Real Estate, Finance or Logistics
Intellectual curiosity and integrity
Motivation and drive to achieve long-term business outcomes
Focus on business efficiency and optimisation
Effective and clear communication skills
Critical thinking mindse
Ability to tackle business challenges with data-driven solutions
Utilizes data concepts adeptly for effective problem-solving



DIVERSITY MAKES US SMARTER

With an exceptionally high number of nationalities and spoken languages we‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone - diversity and inclusion is the DNA of Revantage

Europe. With an average of 3 languages fluently spoken per employee, this unique blend is a real competitive advantage that helps us support Blackstone Real Estate across the European jurisdictions. Thanks to our diversity, we are flexible and able to adapt our response to the challenges we face.
Show more

Title: Data Management, Analyst - Data Science
Company: Revantage Europe, A Blackstone Portfolio Company
Description:
Overview

Who We Are

Revantage is a Corporate Services affiliate of The Blackstone Group, the world‚Äôs largest alternative investment firm. In Pursuit of Better, we deliver exceptional customer experiences to Blackstone and its portfolio companies that enable them to thrive. Revantage provides a highly skilled employee base and state-of-the-art technology to further our key focus on providing best in class Corporate Services to multiple Blackstone real estate portfolio companies. Sectors include Hospitality, Industrial, Multi-Family, Office, Retail, Senior Housing, and Manufactured Homes.

Revantage Europe, headquartered in Luxembourg, is one of four global offices that includes Revantage Asia, Revantage North America and Revantage Australia and New Zealand.

What We Value - Our Culture

Creating a culture that inspires change and momentum requires the right team. We know what it takes to lead an industry, and are looking for leaders who seek constant growth, want to excel, and continuously improve upon themselves and the industry. The culture at Revantage is built on our shared core values and commitment to be:


Achievers ‚Äì We expect high standards for ourselves and enable the success of our teams;
Enthusiasts - We face challenges with optimism and believe anything is possible;
Leaders - We commit to continuously improve our performance;
Learners ‚Äì We learn from our challenges, successes and the diversity of our people;
Partners - We deliver value and positive impact to our partners.



Why This Role Is Valuable

The role serves as a bridge between raw data and actionable business insights. Applies tools and techniques for business analysis to summarize and present insights in the most appropriate format. Expected to effectively communicate with management and stakeholders, aiding them in comprehending business needs, identifying pain points and inefficiencies, and leveraging data for strategic business decisions.

Responsibilities


Data Transformation & Querying: Write and optimize complex SQL queries to extract, clean, and transform data from disparate sources (e.g., Snowflake, Azure DevOps)
AI & LLM Integration: Leverage LLMs and other AI tools to automate workflows, extract structured data from unstructured sources, and enhance operational efficiency
Analytical Modeling: Apply statistical and analytical techniques to uncover trends, identify opportunities, and support business growth
Visualization & Reporting: Build dashboards and reports in Sigma and Power BI to communicate insights to internal and external stakeholders
Collaborative Problem Solving: Partner with cross-functional teams to understand business needs, identify inefficiencies, and propose data-driven solutions
Real Estate Intelligence: Apply basic financial literacy and (ideally) familiarity with real estate concepts to contextualize data and insights
Innovation & Application: Translate theoretical concepts into practical applications that deliver measurable value



Qualifications

What You Bring To The Role

Technical Proficiency:


2-3 years of relevant experience in data science, analytics, or a related field
Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or another quantitative discipline
Strong SQL skills with experience in ETL pipelines and data transformation
Familiarity with Python and interest in AI/LLM technologies
Experience with BI tools such as Power BI or Sigma for dashboarding and reporting
Solid foundation in statistics, mathematics, and data analysis
Basic financial literacy and understanding of core investment and real estate concepts
Ability to apply analytical thinking to finance, accounting, and business strategy
Strong problem-solving mindset with a results-oriented approach
Excellent communication skills, especially in translating technical insights for non-technical stakeholders
Collaborative team player who thrives in cross-functional environments



DIVERSITY MAKES US SMARTER

With an exceptionally high number of nationalities and spoken languages we‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone ‚Äî diversity and inclusion is the DNA of Revantage Europe. With an average of 3 languages fluently spoken per employee, this unique blend is a real competitive advantage that helps us support Blackstone Real Estate across the European jurisdictions. Thanks to our diversity, we are flexible and able to adapt our response to the challenges we face.

Title: Junior Business Support Analyst
Description:
Empower, Connect, Evolve, and Inspire - these are the values that drive us and make BMI a company where you can thrive and grow.

JUNIOR BUSINESS SUPPORT ANALYST

Will report to the Senior Group Procurement Analyst and will be based at our company operational headquarters in Luxembourg.

This role supports procurement data management, reporting, and analytics to drive informed decision-making. Key responsibilities include maintaining databases, updating market indexes, managing and creating dashboards, and supporting supplier management processes.

Key Responsibilities


Market Data Management: Update daily market indexes related to raw materials in procurement databases to ensure accurate and up-to-date information.
Reporting & Budgeting Support: Serve as the gatekeeper for data entry in reporting and budgeting processes, ensuring timely and accurate input. Create and maintain reporting templates for seamless data integration.
Price Updates: Maintain and update pricing for centrally managed categories in the ERP system.
Data Analysis & Ad-hoc Requests: Support the procurement team with data analysis and fulfill ad-hoc data requests as needed.
Database Management: Maintain procurement databases within Google Sheets ensuring data quality, consolidation from multiple sources, and proper structuring for efficient processing.
Dashboard Development & Maintenance: Improve and maintain existing dashboards in Looker Studio, and design new dashboards to support business needs.
Supplier Management Support: Assist in supplier management processes by developing internal tools or facilitating the implementation of external solutions.


Professional Experience & Qualifications


Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets/Excel for data manipulation and analysis.
Ability to translate raw data into interactive dashboards for effective visualization.
Basic understanding of Business Intelligence (BI) concepts for report and dashboard creation.
Basic programming skills (e.g., SQL, Java) are a plus.


Skills & Attributes


Strong analytical skills with excellent attention to detail.
Business-oriented mindset with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to learn quickly.
Effective communication and presentation skills across all levels of the organization.
Proactive, inquisitive, and comfortable working across different countries and functions.
Interest in emerging technologies and their application in data management and business processes.
Experience with Google Workspace is a plus.


Education: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.

A career with BMI Group is more than just a job. We help you to find work you enjoy, to use your skills, and support you to become the best you can be.

Working together we can achieve great things. Come and join us.
Show more

Title: Master Data Management Analyst
Description:
Since 2016, Pictet Technologies, the Pictet Group‚Äôs software house, has established itself as a group of strongly rooted, agile professionals, with a long-term vision and a deep sense of commitment. We have created an open, team-driven and innovative culture, recognized by several awards (People Experience, Great Place to Work, Luxembourg Flagship, CIO of the year).




As Pictet Technologies continues to grow, we are expending our implementation team for Pictet‚Äôs Enterprise Data Management (EDM) program using NeoXam Data Hub (NDH).

Therefore, we are looking for Master Data Management Analyst with experience in Data Management Tools to support our Core banking product.




In this context, as part of a scrum team, your mission will be to:

Collect and analyze the needs expressed by the relevant business lines within the framework of evolution and maintenance projects.
Design and propose pragmatic IT solutions in close collaboration with development teams and architects.
Propose and influence innovative solutions.
Gather client requirements, leverage best practices and industry standards (be involved in the settings: propose data interfaces, define quality checks and design NDH data dictionary).
Develop and execute functional tests.
Handle, document, and analyze production incidents, as well as third-level support requests.
Write functional specifications iteratively according to Agile methodology, validate them with sponsors, and communicate them to the teams responsible for implementation (including stakeholders outside the main team).




Our candidates should have:

A proven experience in business analysis and ideally a background in data management
Strong understanding and expertise in business areas such as:
Financial instruments, pricing and indices domain
Experience in one or more financial data providers (ex. Bloomberg, Six, WMdaten, Reuters, Fund Info, ‚Ä¶)
Transactional flows in and out
Funds domain
Legal reporting
SQL Knowledge
Ideally, experience with NeoXam Data Hub or similar Master Data Management systems.
Knowledge of industrial software development tools and practices, including products like Jira, Wiki, and Xray
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within an agile team.




And also:

An agile mind-set. It‚Äôs not a buzz word: agility is about collaboration, growing together, supporting more junior team members, intellectual humility and strong desire to learn
Proven ability to deliver against deadlines
True team player as teamwork is at the heart of everything we do, within a strong feedback culture
Fluency in French and English




In addition to solid technical knowledge and experience, we are looking for passionate individuals with a well-rounded personality and a good sense of humour: we don‚Äôt compromise on these.




What we offer:

An innovative and supportive working culture fostering collaboration, professional development and learning opportunities
Top-notch technologies and premium hardware
An opportunity to work and grow alongside inspiring individuals
A room for open and meaningful discussions across the organization
A safe place to share and promote your ideas and vision
Lifestyle in line with the tech world: flexitime, state of the art facilities, dynamic organization
Non-negotiable values: excellence, integrity, respect, fun







Limited travel required. Please note that an EU valid work permit is required. Thank you.

Please note that only applications meeting the key requirements will be considered.




Follow us on LinkedIn, Medium, Instagram, Facebook

Title: Client Service Control Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Client Service Control analyst

About Schroders

Schroders is a global investment manager which helps institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.

Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to our clients through active management. By serving clients, we serve wider society. Channelling capital into sustainable and durable businesses accelerates positive change in the world. Funding the future is a privilege: we use it wisely and responsibly.

We employ over 6000 talented people worldwide operating in 38 different locations across Europe, the Americas, Asia, Africa and the Middle East, close to the markets in which we invest and close to our clients.

Schroders has developed under stable ownership for over 200 years and long-term thinking governs our approach to investing, building client relationships and growing our business.

The team

The Client Service Control team is part of the Schroder Investment Management (Europe) S.A. (‚ÄúSIM EU‚Äù) Client Service department in Luxembourg.

The Client Service Control team generates Management Information (MI) and detailed reports for management and the board, enabling informed decision-making. The team also manages the SIM EU Marketing Committee and ensures the oversight of segregated mandates. The team administers the applications used by the department, driving operational excellence and ongoing improvement. The team collaborates with the Client Service Manager and AML/KYC/KYD colleagues to ensure successful delivery of the deliverables.

The team is also responsible for all the life cycle of French FCPs as well as the lifecycle of all discretionary portfolio management signed with SIM EU. This includes oversight of institutional reporting and RFPs management (review, validation, approval).

Key Responsibilities Of The Team Include

Data collation and dashboard production: Collecting and analysing data to create monthly management information (MI) dashboards to provide visibility on performance metrics and risks.

Reporting: Preparing detailed reports for the Management Committee and Boards. Performing the oversight of all reports sent to institutional investors having a mandate with SIM EU.

Marketing Committee management: Managing all aspects of SIM EU Marketing Committee meetings, including preparation and administrative tasks (organisation of the meeting agenda, preparation of minutes, logging of approvals etc). Getting the approval to participate to non standard RFPs, binding RFPS as well as new business model in the institutional business line.

Support and oversight of segregated mandates and French FCPs: Assist with RFPs/tenders, onboardings tasks and obtain relevant sign-offs and signatures. For live mandates and FCPs, lead in the oversight role of the team and communicate any mandate changes or terminations to SIM EU stakeholders, ensuring follow-up until completion. Assist with client queries and reporting. Prepare relevant data and KPIs for reporting to management, coordinate with other departments to ensure regulatory reports and completed.

System and application administration: Administering the systems and applications used within the department.

Process Optimisation: Exploring better methods and technologies, including the use of artificial intelligence, to enhance processes and improve service delivery.

The Role And What You Will Do

You will support the team in delivering across each pillar of the team‚Äôs responsibilities.


Governance reporting production - You will lead in the collation of content and data to draft papers and management information (MI) dashboards for the various governance committees at SIM EU (management committee, boards); therefore, a willingness to learn new applications such as PowerBI, PowerApps and Service Now will be required.
Workflow optimisation
Leverage in-house Generative AI systems to develop task-specific personas that support our tasks and challenges to enhance operational efficiency (e.g. RFP content, report summaries, document drafting/lookup etc.).
Marketing Committee
You will coordinate the management of the Marketing Committee; preparing the meeting pack, organising the agenda, writing the minutes, noting actions, maintaining the log of committee approvals and key decisions.
Overtime, identify suitable digital documentation tools integrated with SharePoint and Microsoft Power Platform to improve the efficiency of the process.
Support the Discretionary Portfolio Management (‚ÄúDPM‚Äù) client lifecycle
Leverage in-house tools/AI to support lifecycle management of discretionary mandates and institutional clients by coordinating mandate change tracking, onboarding flows, and reporting protocols.
Liaise with compliance to ensure business processes align with CSSF and EU regulations as needed.
Verify the accuracy of the reports before they are being sent to investors and ensure timely delivery.
Make sure that investors are getting all the mandatory and bespoke reporting on time.
Respond to client inquiries regarding mandates and French FCPs.
Training and development
Participate in ongoing training to stay informed about market trends, AI, investment philosophies, and regulatory developments.


The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications You Need


Good organisational skills and capability to work independently and with commitment to deliver under tight deadlines
Skills/curiosity in Generative AI and prompting
Knowledge of the Microsoft Office applications, in particular Excel, Word and Power Point.
Knowledge of Microsoft Power Platform is a plus (Power BI, Power Automate, Power Apps)
Fluency in English (verbal and written) is mandatory


The Knowledge, Experience And Qualifications That Will Help


Forward-thinking, innovative and proactive
Self-educating, curious and pragmatic
Analytical attitude dedicated to continuous improvement and innovation
Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills


We Recognise Potential, Whoever You Are

Our purpose is to provide excellent investment performance to clients through active management. Diversity of thought facilitated by an inclusive culture will allow us to make better decisions and better achieve our purpose. This is why inclusion and diversity are a strategic priority for us and why we are an equal opportunities employer: you are welcome here regardless of your age, disability, gender identity, religious beliefs, sexual orientation, socio-economic background or any other protected characteristics.

About Us

We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future.

We have around 6,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist (11-month Fixed-Term Contract)
Description:
Job Location: Luxembourg

Company Description

Ferrero is a family-owned company with a truly progressive and global outlook and iconic brands such as Nutella¬Æ, Tic Tac¬Æ, Ferrero Rocher¬Æ, Raffaello¬Æ, Kinder Bueno¬Æ and Kinder Surprise¬Æ. As the love for our brands continues to grow, so too does our global reach. Represented in more than 50 countries, with products sold in more than 170, the Ferrero Group is loved by generations around the world. The secret to our global success? 40,000 dedicated employees who celebrate care and quality to craft a business, careers and brands we are proud of. Join us, and you could be one of them.

Diversity Statement

Ferrero is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture in which all employees feel welcomed and appreciated and have the same opportunities. We believe all of our people are equally talented in their own way. In nurturing the curiosity and natural abilities of our employees, we provide them, generation after generation, the means to succeed personally and professionally, enabling them to craft their journey at Ferrero. The diversity of our talents is what makes our work environment multicultural, innovative and highly rewarding.

About the Role:

For our Global Headquarters, we are looking for Business Intelligence Specialist to join our Trade Marketing department in the Travel Market business unit.

Main Responsibilities:

Thanks to your ability to manage and improve data systems, you will oversee the sell-out database and contribute to its continuous evolution. You will work on enhancing current reporting tools and developing new ones, making sure they respond to the specific needs of the business unit. Your role includes adapting existing reports and integrating additional key data, allowing for a more complete and actionable view of the market and internal performance.

You will play a consistent role in providing insights and identifying key trends to support business decisions. This includes developing and maintaining dashboards, mainly using Power BI, that monitor company figures, key performance indicators, market share, and passenger traffic. You will also assist in the selection of appropriate tools for various departments, helping them align their operational needs with the available data solutions.

Your contributions will extend to preparing regular newsletters and ad hoc reports that highlight key findings and support business planning. In parallel, you will be involved in revenue management by analyzing promo return on investment and helping define promotional guidelines in collaboration with the team.

Who we are looking for:

Thanks to your academic background in management, engineering, or statistics, you bring a solid foundation for understanding both technical and business dynamics. With 2 to 4 years of experience in Trade Marketing or Business Intelligence roles, you‚Äôre already familiar with the environment and tools that support commercial strategy and data-driven decision-making.

You will rely on your analytical mindset, conceptual thinking, and problem-solving approach to interpret complex information and generate practical insights. Your ability to manage several priorities at once, while adapting to shifting needs, will help you stay effective in a dynamic setting. Clear and structured communication‚Äîboth written and spoken‚Äîwill support your contributions within cross-functional project teams.

Your daily work will involve advanced use of Excel and Power BI, and your familiarity with SQL will be a valuable addition. Fluency in English will allow you to collaborate across teams and regions, while any additional language skills will be appreciated as an extra asset.

Are you ready for this great challenge? Don‚Äôt miss the chance to apply!

How to be successful in the role and at Ferrero:

Consumers, quality and care are at the heart of everything we do. So, to be successful at Ferrero, you‚Äôll need to be just as consumer and product centric as we are - dedicated to crafting brilliant results for consumers around the world.

Title: IT Analyst-Business Intelligence
Description:
About Northern Trust

Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.

Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world‚Äôs most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world‚Äôs most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.

The Key Responsibilities Of The Role Include


Analyse business needs and transform them into functional IT specifications
Design, propose and document effective solutions in close collaboration with business and technical teams
Participate in projects and acts as an intermediary between IT and business departments
Create test cases and test new functionalities and ensure the quality and reliability of solutions
Manage all administrative tasks around change implementation
Provide production support and ensure continuity of BI services
Identify and drive improvements that bring added value to our fund administration operations
Produce User-guide and organise trainings when required


The Successful Candidate Will Benefit From Having


Experience in fund administration business processes
A solid understanding of fund accounting (preferably with experience in GP4)
Sound knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL for Oracle databases
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a solution-oriented mindset
Demonstrated ability to clearly explain complex requirements and technical solutions in an understandable way
A self-motivated and proactive attitude
Strong consulting and communication skills to effectively manage stakeholder expectations
Experience in SAP Business Objects or any other Business Intelligence Suite is considered a strong asset
Fluency in English (German, Luxembourgish, French is a plus)


Working With Us

As a Northern Trust partner, greater achievements await. You will be part of a flexible and collaborative work culture in an organization where financial strength and stability is an asset that emboldens us to explore new ideas.

Movement within the organization is encouraged, senior leaders are accessible, and you can take pride in working for a company committed to assisting the communities we serve! Join a workplace with a greater purpose.

We‚Äôd love to learn more about how your interests and experience could be a fit with one of the world‚Äôs most admired and sustainable companies! Build your career with us and apply today. #MadeForGreater

Reasonable accommodation

Northern Trust is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please email our HR Service Center at MyHRHelp@ntrs.com.

We hope you‚Äôre excited about the role and the opportunity to work with us. We value an inclusive workplace and understand flexibility means different things to different people.

Apply today and talk to us about your flexible working requirements and together we can achieve greater.

Title: Senior Data Engineer/Analyst 100% (m, f, d)
Description:
At Julius Baer, we celebrate and value the individual qualities you bring, enabling you to be impactful, to be entrepreneurial, to be empowered, and to create value beyond wealth. Let‚Äôs shape the future of wealth management together.

We're seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer/Analyst to join our team, playing a key role in designing, building, and maintaining large-scale data systems that drive business decision-making. As a senior member of our data team, you will collaborate with stakeholders to gather business requirements and develop scalable, stable, and fit-for-purpose engineering solutions.

YOUR CHALLENGE


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes that meet the needs of our business stakeholders.
Develop and optimize data architectures for access, analytics, and reporting, ensuring data integrity, security, and compliance with industry best practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deliver a new BI and Analytics Platform, leveraging your expertise in data warehousing and reporting.
Partner with stakeholders to gather business requirements and develop engineering solutions that meet their needs, while ensuring alignment with our overall business strategy.
Identify technical obstacles early and work collaboratively with teams to define appropriate technology solutions, ensuring timely and effective resolution of issues.
Coordinate, execute, and support system and integration testing to ensure seamless delivery of data solutions.
Document solutions delivered and share knowledge with other teams to promote collaboration and continuous learning.
Work in an agile project environment, collaborating with other Scrum, product, and technology teams to achieve the best possible outcomes for the bank and its customers.
Participate in the resolution of production incidents, analyzing issues, specifying solutions, and implementing fixes.


YOUR PROFILE


About You:
You have a strong background in data engineering and analysis, with at least 5 years of experience in the financial sector/banking industry.
You possess excellent analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to distill complex problems into actionable insights.
You are collaborative and able work effectively with stakeholders at all levels, from technical teams to business leaders.
Essential Skills:
Strong proficiency in data modeling and database management.
Experience with data warehousing and reporting, including data mart design and development.
Expertise in data ingestion and transformation tools, such as SQL, Python, Spark, dbt, or equivalent.
Familiarity with version control (Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts, including SCD, ODS, and SDS.
Ability to synthesize and aggregate data in DataMart.
Proficiency in reporting and visualization tools, such as Tableau, SSRS, or equivalent.
Experience with banking applications data models, with knowledge of systems such as Temenos T24, Triple A, or other equivalent systems being a plus.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Higher academic education in computer science or other related disciplines.
Good problem-solving and analytical skills, with experience in troubleshooting and resolving technical issues.
Excellent written and verbal skills in English, with any additional languages (such as French or German) being an asset.


We are looking forward to receiving your full job application through our online application tool. Further interesting job opportunities can be found on our Career site.

Is this not quite what you are looking for? Set up a job alert by creating a candidate account here.

Title: Data Innovation Engineer Trainee (m/f/d)
HTML:
PwC Luxembourg is hiring a Data Innovation Engineer Trainee (m/f/d). What if it was you?

Who we are: PwC Luxembourg (www.pwc.lu) is the largest professional services firm in Luxembourg with over‚ÄØ3,800 people employed from 90‚ÄØdifferent countries. PwC Luxembourg provides audit, tax and advisory services including management consulting, transaction, financing and regulatory advice. The firm provides advice to a wide variety of clients from local and middle market entrepreneurs to large multinational companies operating from Luxembourg and the Greater Region. The firm supports its clients in creating the value they are looking for by contributing to the smooth operation of the capital markets and providing advice through an industry-focused approach.

At PwC, we help clients build trust and reinvent so they can turn complexity into competitive advantage. We‚Äôre a tech-forward, people-empowered network with more than 370,000 people in 149 countries. Across audit and assurance, tax and legal, deals and consulting we help build, accelerate and sustain momentum. Find out more at www.pwc.com and www.pwc.lu.

Your mission:

  • Understand and analyze our client‚Äôs business‚Äôs needs (local and international clients in multiple industries: alternatives industries (PE/RE), commercial companies, investment funds, banks, insurance, ‚Ä¶);
  • Implement digital solutions servicing client problems;
  • Understand our audit processes and methodology standards;
  • Translate audit tasks into algorithms with quantitative and qualitative criteria;
  • Participate in data analytics projects (involving modelling, predictive analysis, big data);
  • Build proof-of-concepts and support their practical implementation into a platform;
  • Support cross-functional teams in building data analytics solutions;
  • Develop dashboard solutions (Power BI, ‚Ä¶) to help our clients monitoring their businesses, to create visual decision and selection tools and to enhance our reportings to clients.

Let‚Äôs talk about you. If you have (or will soon have) ‚Ä¶

  • Currently completing a Bachelor or Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science or IT technology, ideally with some knowledge of finance;
  • Some experience in the design and implementation of projects involving data analytics and big data;
  • Analytical skills that allow you to quickly understand a problem, to identify possible solutions and key success factors;
  • A very strong motivation, as well as analytical skills and rigorousness behavior;
  • A good team player, capable of working on multiple requests;
  • Demonstrate to have good interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal;
  • An excellent command of English. Any additional language would be an asset (French, German, Luxembourgish ...).

‚Ä¶You are the candidate we are looking for!

A final word about us:

At PwC, we believe diversity is the representation of all the characteristics that make us both alike and unique. Our backgrounds, cultures, nationalities, lifestyles, identities, opinions and beliefs, approaches to solving problems, ways of working, and views of personal and professional success, all add value to the services we deliver to our clients. Our objective is to nurture an inclusive environment where a diversity mindset is ingrained, and inclusion is the norm. We constantly focus on respecting and valuing individual differences.

Ready to grow your potential, reaching excellence together? Apply now!

Want to keep up with our latest updates? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook | TikTok

Title: Business Analyst, Regulatory Intelligence Safety and Compliance, Global Data Analytics
Description:
Description

At Amazon, our goal is to be earth‚Äôs most customer-centric company and to create a safe environment for both our customers and our associates. To achieve that, we need exceptionally talented, bright, dynamic, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. We are looking for a talented business analyst to join the Regulatory Intelligence, Safety & Compliance Global Data & Analytics (RISC GDA) team.

This role will be a key member of the Science and Analytics team, responsible for driving analysis and insights to help make meaningful business decisions. As a Business Analyst, you will focus on improving the success within business functions by analyzing data, discovering and solving real world problems, building metrics and business cases to improve customer experience, and providing timely data support for escalations to mitigate risk. We are focused on your success and want to build future leaders within Amazon. A key component of the role is to identify process and system improvement opportunities by developing the right metrics, analyzing data, and partnering with internal teams. In addition, you will design and develop automated reporting solutions to enable stakeholders to manage the business and make effective decisions. Lastly, you will enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.

This role requires an individual with excellent statistical and analytical abilities, deep knowledge of business intelligence solutions and good business acumen. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and driven by a desire to innovate in this space. They have experience in working directly with large data sets, and will be required to make important decisions on defining, building, and scaling data processes and reports through directly with stakeholders and other data and tech professionals.

Key job responsibilities


Creating automated reports and dashboards with a combination of BI tools such as Quicksight
Partnering with program team, Legal, and Tech stakeholders to understand challenges and provide /analysis to help drive program success
Providing data support for business and cross-functional partners to address escalations and answer questions using PostgreSQL and AWS solutions
Uncovering trends and correlations through mining and analysis to develop insights that can help stakeholders to make effective decisions
Designing and executing analytical projects using statistical analysis
Create mechanisms for non-technical stakeholders to self-serve data including during urgent issue management
Look for opportunities to simplify and automate redundant processes


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
Experience with SQL
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
Experience in business or financial analysis
Familiarity with AWS solutions such as EC2, Dynamo DB, S3, Redshift, and RDS.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon EU Sarl - A84
