The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, and driven by a desire to innovate in this space. They have experience in working directly with large data sets, and will be required to make important decisions on defining, building, and scaling data processes and reports through directly with stakeholders and other data and tech professionals.

Key job responsibilities

  • Creating automated reports and dashboards with a combination of BI tools such as Quicksight
  • Partnering with program team, Legal, and Tech stakeholders to understand challenges and provide /analysis to help drive program success
  • Providing data support for business and cross-functional partners to address escalations and answer questions using PostgreSQL and AWS solutions
  • Uncovering trends and correlations through mining and analysis to develop insights that can help stakeholders to make effective decisions
  • Designing and executing analytical projects using statistical analysis
  • Create mechanisms for non-technical stakeholders to self-serve data including during urgent issue management
  • Look for opportunities to simplify and automate redundant processes

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent
  • Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
  • Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in Excel (including VBA, pivot tables, array functions, power pivots, etc.) and data visualization tools such as Tableau
  • Experience in business or financial analysis
  • Familiarity with AWS solutions such as EC2, Dynamo DB, S3, Redshift, and RDS.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Data engineer Trainee
HTML:
We are looking for several enthusiastic, dynamic, and talented students (year-off or end of studies) to join our teams in July 2025.

Responsibilities:

Your role within our teams is to:

  • Analyze data to find the best solutions for business needs.
  • Design and implement reports to support business operations.
  • Deploy dashboards for top management to track corporate KPIs.
  • Collaborate with the business team to improve the quality of data in the ERP.
    • Mass update
    • Data quality report and MDM control
  • Support the ERP team on daily activities.

Your profile :

  • You follow a Master's degree oriented in data engineering or data management ;
  • Advanced competence with spreadsheet tools ;
  • You have experience or knowledge on Workday and Salesforce would be an asset;
  • You are fluent in French and English;
  • You are self-motivated, proactive, have a positive attitude, and you possess a willingness to learn;
  • You have good interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Knowledges of accounting, finance or management control is considered as an advantage;
  • Being able to work as full-time Trainee for minimum 6 months;
  • Mandatory school internship agreement.

We offer you:

By joining Forvis Mazars Luxembourg, you will have the opportunity to:

  • Evolve in a company that provides a young, dynamic and friendly environment;
  • Benefit from the principle of non-sectorisation by working with different clients by their size (groups on the stock market, SME ...) and their sector (Banks / PSF, Commercial companies, Insurance, Investment funds, Private Equity and Real Estate);
  • Benefit from a training program during the first weeks of your integration in order to learn our methodology and to acquire technical expertise on accounting standards and the Luxembourg legal environment;
  • At the end of your internship, you can potentially be hired as a Junior Auditor.

Title: Consulting - Data Analyst AI - Senior
Description:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The opportunity

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Data Analyst / AI Consultant with a minimum of 5 years of professional experience. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in data management, hold relevant certifications, and have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. This role requires proficiency in data governance tools such as Microsoft Purview, Collibra, and Informatica, as well as the ability to adapt to various technologies and client-specific solutions.

Your Key Responsibilities


Data Management, Analysis, and Visualization: Lead the collection, organization, and analysis of data to extract meaningful insights and support data-driven decision-making processes.
AI Solution Development: Design, develop, and implement AI models and algorithms tailored to meet client needs, ensuring scalability and integration with existing systems.
Client Consultation: Engage with clients to understand their business objectives, provide expert advice on data strategies, and develop customized solutions that address their unique challenges.
Tool Implementation: Utilize and manage data governance and management tools, including but not limited to Microsoft Purview, Collibra, and Informatica, to ensure data quality, compliance, and accessibility.
Project Coordination: Participate in projects from inception to completion, coordinating with cross-functional teams to deliver solutions on time and within budget.
Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends to continually enhance skills and apply innovative approaches to client solutions.


Skills And Attributes For Success


Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline.
Professional Experience: At least 5 years of experience in data analysis, AI consulting, or related fields.
Certifications: Relevant certifications in data management, AI, or specific tools such as Microsoft Purview, Collibra, or Informatica are highly desirable.
Experience in data governance platforms like Microsoft Purview, Collibra, and Informatica.
Experience in Microsoft Azure platform
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Fluent in English and French (Spoken and written)


Ideally, you‚Äôll also


Experience with data visualization tools and AI frameworks.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.


What we look for

Adaptability: Demonstrated ability to learn and implement new technologies quickly, adapting to various client environments and industry-specific solutions.

What We Offer You

At EY, we‚Äôll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. We‚Äôll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

Title: Digital Factory - Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At EY, we‚Äôre all in to shape your future with confidence.

We‚Äôll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world

Digital Factory - Senior Data Analyst

The opportunity

We are seeking a talented and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our dynamic Digital Factory team at EY Luxembourg. In this role, you will analyze, develop, support, and maintain applications using Azure Data Factory (ADF). You will collaborate with stakeholders to gather feedback, ensure the application performs as expected in the production environment, and maintain high levels of customer satisfaction.

Your Key Responsibilities


Analyze, Develop, support and maintain data integration pipelines in Azure Data Factory and manage data flows
Design and develop ETL processes, implementing data transformation logic
Engage with senior leaders to understand business goals and gather requirements
Write and maintain stored procedures in SQL Server for data validation and processing
Create and maintain documentation, ensuring security and compliance
Design data lake solutions and implement data governance frameworks
Optimize data integration processes for performance and scalability
Develop, support and maintain CI/CD pipelines for data solutions and provide technical leadership
Assist in the logging, tracking, and resolution of incidents and problems
Providing root cause analysis and weekly reporting of these incidents
Maintain and update service management documentation, including policies, procedures, and user guides
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of a knowledge base for service management
Ensure quality and smooth scheduling/running of automated processes in production
Work closely with other team members and departments to ensure seamless service delivery
Taking responsibility ensuring change control and change management procedures are followed while deploying/fixing things in production
Participate in service improvement initiatives and projects
Gather and analyze feedback from users to identify areas for improvement
Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction through effective communication and resolution of issues


Qualify for the Role You Must Have


5+ years of experience as an ADF developer/application support analyst
A degree in Computer Science or a related discipline or a degree in business with technology consulting or technical experiences
Hands-on experience on Azure functions, C# and ASP.net
Experience in Azure Data Lake / Blob (Storage purpose)
Basic understanding on Batch Account configuration, various control options
Coordinate independently with business stakeholders and understand the business requirements, implement the requirements using ADF
Strong proficiency in SQL and Stored procedures
Experience working on building/integrating data into a data warehouse
Working experience in an Agile base delivery will be considered as an asset
Flexible and proactive/self-motivated working style with strong personal ownership of problem resolution
Participate in all aspects of Data integration solution delivery life cycle including analysis, design, development, testing, production deployment, and support
Good knowledge and understanding of ITIL Incident, Problem and Change management process
You are organized, flexible and able to manage several tasks
Excellent communication in English (French will be considered as an asset) and Excellent interpersonal skills
You are a team player and have excellent technical & analytical skills
Experience with PowerApps will be considered as an asset
Experience in Tax will be considered as an asset
Ability to remain calm and patient when dealing with repetitive inquiries
A bit of accounting knowledge would be an advantage
Experience in BPMN 2.0 or UML is a big plus


What We Offer


Dynamic teamwork: You‚Äôll work with brilliant and innovative professionals who are devoted to building a better working world
Continuous learning: You‚Äôll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next
Success as defined by you: We‚Äôll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way
Transformative leadership: We‚Äôll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs
Diverse and inclusive culture: You‚Äôll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It‚Äôs yours to build.

Apply now.

Title: Internship - Power BI Project (KPI Production Monitoring)
Description:
Goodyear. More Driven.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a student who is currently studying a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business related studies and is looking to complete an internship for a duration of 4-6 months.

During this internship, the successful candidate will be involved in a project focusing on the creation of a dynamic digital dashboard using Power BI to display critical Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) based on live data. This includes gathering requirements from various departments, integrating data from multiple sources, designing user-friendly visualizations, and setting up real-time data updates. The goal is to enhance decision-making and operational efficiency by providing accurate, up-to-date insights into machine-level performance.

You will be part of a cross-function team, learning about production management and developing interpersonal skills to gather the correct KPIs to achieve delivery goals. Communication will take place on an international level and will provide to the opportunity to learn more about or tools, analytical team and big data measurement tool (Braincube).

Eligibility

To be eligible to apply for this position, you must meet the following criteria:

Education

You should be enrolled in a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs Degree in a related business field and be able to commit full time to this internship for a duration of 4-6 months for this internship.

Location:

You should be located in a commutable distance to our office in Dudelange, Luxembourg or be looking to relocate for the internship.

You must also have the right to work in Luxembourg for the duration of the internship.

Languages

English is mandatory. German and/or French are considered as an asset

Skills & Others


Motivated and willing to learn production process and technologies.
Good knowledge about MS Power Platform and MS Office (Power Bi, Excel).
Good understanding of databases.
Experience in working on projects including the ability to deliver within predefined timeframes.
Strong communication skills.
Team Player.


Ideal starting date: Flexible but we are looking to accommodate a start date as soon as possible.

Goodyear is one of the world‚Äôs largest tire companies. It employs about 68,000 people and manufactures its products in 53 facilities in 20 countries around the world. Its two Innovation Centers in Akron, Ohio and Colmar-Berg, Luxembourg strive to develop state-of-the-art products and services that set the technology and performance standard for the industry. For more information about Goodyear and its products, go to www.goodyear.com/corporate.

Title: Quantitative Analyst - Data Management & Governance team (f/m/d)
Description:
Your career at Deutsche B√∂rse Group

Your area of work:

As part of the newly established team, you will work on the roll-out of the data governance program across multiple business segments and streams, providing support to businesses during the transformation and, subsequently, maintenance phases. The role foresees taking the lead of one of the workstreams, eventually transitioning into the main point of contact for the stream-related content within Clearstream Data Governance Office.

Your responsibilities:



Support definition and development of Data quality framework, respective policies, standards, and procedures.
Collaborate with business areas, IT counterparts and other relevant functions to conduct data quality assessments, including review, initial conceptualisation and prototyping of data quality KPIs.
Support business requirement definition on enterprise Data Quality Monitoring solutions and KPIs, to ensure consistency across prioritized business areas and data domains.
Collaborate with relevant Data governance and Management stakeholders on the implementation of data quality monitoring tools to systematically measure and monitor the quality of the data. Support business areas in the operationalization of the solutions and transition to BAU.
Collaborate with relevant DMG stakeholders to facilitate resolution of data quality issues and further improvements.
Report on the workstream progress to senior management and DMG stakeholders, as required.
Create, review, and maintain relevant documentation.
Support DMG related impact assessments and queries.
Develop and maintain effective relationships with internal stakeholders and other DMG relevant actors, to ensure good organizational alignment.



Your profile:



Educational background in a quantitative discipline (Quantitative Finance, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or alike).
At least 7 years of proven track record in quantitative roles (data/ business analyst/ model developer focusing on data governance, data quality and/or data analytics etc.).
Sound understanding of data quality dimensions and data quality steering in enterprise-wide context.
Good understanding of financial markets and products, familiarity with post-trade business and Financial Market Infrastructures is an advantage.
Sound knowledge of statistics and econometric methods and their application.
Proven experience in solutions conceptualization and prototyping, fluency in Python/R/SQL or alike. Familiarity with enterprise-grade data quality solutions is an advantage.
Attention to detail, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to draw accurate conclusions based on complex data.
High commitment, team spirit, excellent communication, and interpersonal skills.
Excellent command of written and spoken English. German and/or French will be an asset.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer, Business Intelligence & Analytics
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptional people. Amazon is seeking a Business Intelligence Engineer to join the Strategy, Innovation & Engagement (SI&E), Business Intelligence & Analytics (BI & Analytics) team.

The Global Procurement Organization (GPO) is the single channel for Amazon globally that creates, delivers and maintains core procurement capabilities while executing best-in-class S2P policies, processes and digital solutions. The pillar drives efficiency, control & compliance and delivers a user and supplier centric procurement experience consistently across teams, businesses and regions.

Having actionable analytics is part of our culture and we insist on timely, accurate, scalable and actionable business intelligence. A Business Intelligence Engineer should be able to cope with a fast pace environment, work on multiple deliverables and in parallel, be comfortable with prioritizing efficiently and communicating progress and blockers in an effective manner.

Key job responsibilities


Manage a portfolio of BI solutions (Data Products, Analysis, Dashboards) related to supplier management (performance & risk management, diversity & inclusion etc. ), work with multiple stakeholders and communicate effectively progress and blockers with the project team and sponsors.
Develop ETL jobs and analytical layers that require in depth knowledge in scripting and AWS technologies (S3, Redshift, Glue, Lambda).
Implement metadata management and follow core data governance practices
Develop visualizations that are fast and easy to comprehend.
Adopt existing best practices or contribute to improving them; solution design, development, validation and documentation practices.


A day in the life

A Business Intelligence Engineer manages requirements from a large group of customers, understands how they operate and is able to build solutions that return the right strategic value back to the organization. Improves the way that customers interact with data and analytics. Works cross functionally, interacting with other tech and non-tech teams globally to align on requirements and solutions. Develops and maintains strong networks and partnerships across organizations, builds trusted relationships. Keeps customers and stakeholders up to date. Innovates in data engineering, analysis, statistics and visualization.

About The Team

The BI & Analytics team enables metric-driven capabilities for the Procurement leaders through secure, performant, scalable & sustainable reporting & analysis products. We make the data speak. Providing Amazon-standard customer experience is in our core. We build trust with leaders and provide analysis they need and we do that on a timely and top-quality manner.

Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field
Experience with AWS solutions such as EC2, DynamoDB, S3, and Redshift
Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines
Knowledge of SQL and data warehousing concepts
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools


Preferred Qualifications


Experience developing and presenting recommendations of new metrics allowing better understanding of the performance of the business
Master's degree in BI, finance, engineering, statistics, computer science, mathematics, finance or equivalent quantitative field
Experience with forecasting and statistical analysis


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Job ID: A2967949

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Us

The University of Luxembourg is an international research university with a distinctly multilingual and interdisciplinary character.

Your role

As a Data Engineer, you will play a central role in the development and operation of the University‚Äôs modern data platform. You will design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support analytics, reporting, and data-driven decision-making. Working closely with analysts, data architects, and business stakeholders, you will ensure high-quality, secure, and efficient data integration from diverse sources into our Azure-based data ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Databricks
Develop scalable and maintainable ETL/ELT workflows to ingest data from various systems (e.g., SAP, APIs, databases)
Ensure data quality, consistency, and lineage across all stages of the data lifecycle
Optimize pipeline performance and resource usage in line with Azure best practices
Collaborate with data analysts, integration experts, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Support the implementation of data governance, security, and compliance policies
Document data models, workflows, and technical architecture
Monitor data flows and troubleshoot issues in production environments
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the university‚Äôs data engineering capabilities and platform strategy


Your profile


Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent professional experience
Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory and Databricks, including PySpark or Spark SQL
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL/ELT processes
Familiarity with Delta Lake and working in cloud-native data environments
Knowledge of data governance, access control, and security concepts in Microsoft Azure
Experience with version control, CI/CD practices, and agile development workflows
Exposure to business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI) is a plus
Experience in data integration (e.g., with Workato or similar tools) is considered an asset
Experience integrating data from SAP systems or enterprise applications is an advantage
Fluent in English; French or German is an asset
Strong problem-solving, communication, and documentation skills


We offer


Multilingual and international character. Modern institution with a personal atmosphere. Staff coming from 90 countries. Member of the ‚ÄúUniversity of the Greater Region‚Äù (UniGR)
A modern and dynamic university. High-quality equipment. Close ties to the business world and to the Luxembourg labour market. A unique urban site with excellent infrastructure
A partner for society and industry. Cooperation with European institutions, innovative companies, the Financial Centre and with numerous non-academic partners such as ministries, local governments, associations, NGOs ‚Ä¶


How to apply

Applications should include:


Curriculum Vitae
Cover letter


Early application is highly encouraged, as the applications will be processed upon reception. Please apply ONLINE formally through the HR system. Applications by Email will not be considered.

All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. In line with our values, the University of Luxembourg promotes an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are dedicated to upholding equality and respect for our employees and students.

General information:


Contract Type: Permanent
Work Hours: Full Time 40.0 Hours per Week
Location: Campus Belval
Internal Title: Software developer
Job Reference: UOL07466

Title: Business Analyst, GFP Analytics
Description:
Description

Global Fleet & Products Analytics (GFPA) is looking for a Business Analyst (BA) that will work with business customers to design and engineer analyses that drive operational excellence for Amazon‚Äôs Last Mile delivery operations. This Business Analyst will join BI team that uses 3P data and data from internal partner teams and deliver data/analytic products that influence business critical decisions that scale our fast growing, global delivery fleet.

Responsibilities

Use expertise in qualitative and quantitative analysis to deliver actionable insights to stakeholders

Use skills with business intelligence tools (e.g. QuickSight) to solve complex business problems with intuitive metrics and visualizations.

Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing and ad-hoc metrics, reports, and analyses that drive optimizations in our fleet

Define data elements to enable analytical and reporting capabilities, and work cross-functionally with other tech teams and country business teams

Solve complex business problems that optimize and enhance all AMZL fleet operations

Explore and develop expertise with internal Amazon data services and public AWS products including Redshift, QuickSight, Lambda/Glue, and more

Basic Qualifications


Experience in business or financial analysis
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with SQL
Experience making business recommendations and influencing stakeholders


Preferred Qualifications


Master's degree in business or analytical discipline

Amazon has focused on being "Earth's most customer-centric company." Experience writing complex Excel VBA macros
Bachelor's degree or equivalent
Experience defining requirements and using data and metrics to draw business insights
Experience with SQL or ETL

Experience using very large datasets

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us

The University of Luxembourg is an international research university with a distinctly multilingual and interdisciplinary character.

Your role

As a Data Engineer, you will play a central role in the development and operation of the University's modern data platform. You will design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support analytics, reporting, and data-driven decision-making. Working closely with analysts, data architects, and business stakeholders, you will ensure high-quality, secure, and efficient data integration from diverse sources into our Azure-based data ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities:

Design and implement data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Databricks
Develop scalable and maintainable ETL/ELT workflows to ingest data from various systems (e.g., SAP, APIs, databases)
Ensure data quality, consistency, and lineage across all stages of the data lifecycle
Optimize pipeline performance and resource usage in line with Azure best practices
Collaborate with data analysts, integration experts, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Support the implementation of data governance, security, and compliance policies
Document data models, workflows, and technical architecture
Monitor data flows and troubleshoot issues in production environments
Contribute to the continuous improvement of the university's data engineering capabilities and platform strategy

Your profile

Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent professional experience
Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory and Databricks, including PySpark or Spark SQL
Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL/ELT processes
Familiarity with Delta Lake and working in cloud-native data environments
Knowledge of data governance, access control, and security concepts in Microsoft Azure
Experience with version control, CI/CD practices, and agile development workflows
Exposure to business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI) is a plus
Experience in data integration (e.g., with Workato or similar tools) is considered an asset
Experience integrating data from SAP systems or enterprise applications is an advantage
Fluent in English; French or German is an asset
Strong problem-solving, communication, and documentation skills

We offer

Multilingual and international character. Modern institution with a personal atmosphere. Staff coming from 90 countries. Member of the "University of the Greater Region" (UniGR)
A modern and dynamic university. High-quality equipment. Close ties to the business world and to the Luxembourg labour market. A unique urban site with excellent infrastructure
A partner for society and industry. Cooperation with European institutions, innovative companies, the Financial Centre and with numerous non-academic partners such as ministries, local governments, associations, NGOs ‚Ä¶

How to apply

Applications should include:

Curriculum Vitae
Cover letter

Early application is highly encouraged, as the applications will be processed upon reception. Please apply ONLINE formally through the HR system. Applications by Email will not be considered.

All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. In line with our values, the University of Luxembourg promotes an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are dedicated to upholding equality and respect for our employees and students.

General information:

Contract Type: Permanent
Work Hours: Full Time 40.0 Hours per Week
Location: Campus Belval
Internal Title: Software developer
Job Reference: UOL07466

.

The University of Luxembourg is an international research university with a distinctly multilingual and interdisciplinary character.

Your role

As a Data Engineer, you will play a central role in the development and operation of the University's modern data platform. You will design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support analytics, reporting, and data-driven decision-making. Working closely with analysts, data architects, and business stakeholders, you will ensure high-quality, secure, and efficient data integration from diverse sources into our Azure-based data ecosystem.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement data pipelines using Azure Data Factory and Databricks
  • Develop scalable and maintainable ETL/ELT workflows to ingest data from various systems (e.g., SAP, APIs, databases)
  • Ensure data quality, consistency, and lineage across all stages of the data lifecycle
  • Optimize pipeline performance and resource usage in line with Azure best practices
  • Collaborate with data analysts, integration experts, and business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into technical solutions
  • Support the implementation of data governance, security, and compliance policies
  • Document data models, workflows, and technical architecture
  • Monitor data flows and troubleshoot issues in production environments
  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of the university's data engineering capabilities and platform strategy

Your profile

  • Degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent professional experience
  • Hands-on experience with Azure Data Factory and Databricks, including PySpark or Spark SQL
  • Strong understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL/ELT processes
  • Familiarity with Delta Lake and working in cloud-native data environments
  • Knowledge of data governance, access control, and security concepts in Microsoft Azure
  • Experience with version control, CI/CD practices, and agile development workflows
  • Exposure to business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI) is a plus
  • Experience in data integration (e.g., with Workato or similar tools) is considered an asset
  • Experience integrating data from SAP systems or enterprise applications is an advantage
  • Fluent in English; French or German is an asset
  • Strong problem-solving, communication, and documentation skills

We offer

  • Multilingual and international character. Modern institution with a personal atmosphere. Staff coming from 90 countries. Member of the "University of the Greater Region" (UniGR)
  • A modern and dynamic university. High-quality equipment. Close ties to the business world and to the Luxembourg labour market. A unique urban site with excellent infrastructure
  • A partner for society and industry. Cooperation with European institutions, innovative companies, the Financial Centre and with numerous non-academic partners such as ministries, local governments, associations, NGOs ‚Ä¶

How to apply

Applications should include:

  • Curriculum Vitae
  • Cover letter

Early application is highly encouraged, as the applications will be processed upon reception. Please apply ONLINE formally through the HR system. Applications by Email will not be considered.

All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply. In line with our values, the University of Luxembourg promotes an inclusive culture. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and are dedicated to upholding equality and respect for our employees and students.

General information:

  • Contract Type: Permanent
  • Work Hours: Full Time 40.0 Hours per Week
  • Location: Campus Belval
  • Internal Title: Software developer
  • Job Reference: UOL07466

.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Welcome to Byborg! As a leader in IT and streaming solutions, we specialize in delivering high-quality services that offer premium online experiences.




Headquartered in Luxembourg and operating globally, our company is proud of its diversity, with over 40 different nationalities working side by side. Since its launch, our flagship product has led the market, continually pushing the boundaries of digital innovation. Today, working with the latest technology, our platforms serve millions of users daily.




We are proud of our dynamic portfolio, featuring over 16 leading and fast-growing brands. These include our streaming platforms (LiveJasmin.com, Cherry.TV, IsLive.com, Oranum.com), our marketing and advertising services (AdSupply, AWEmpire, TwinRed), and our entertainment and lifestyle brands (AdultTime.com, LoyalFans.com, The Million Roses, Kinkly.com).




Are you looking for new challenges in an international, collaborative environment? The Byborg squad is seeking passionate individuals ready to make an impact. Join us in our inclusive workplace where you will be appreciated, and you can grow and achieve your potential.




Help us shape the future!




Join our Data Engineering team at Byborg and help power LiveJasmin, one of the world's largest video streaming platforms with millions of users and high-throughput systems. You'll work at the intersection of large-scale data processing, experimentation, and personalized user experiences ‚Äî building the infrastructure that enables insight, innovation, and strategic decisions across the business.




This is a high-impact role where your work will be felt across product development, user experience, and business intelligence. You'll work alongside experienced engineers, analysts, and product teams in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where data truly drives decisions.




What you will do:




Build Scalable, Reliable Data Infrastructure




Design and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines using BigQuery, dbt, Dataform, and Cloud Dataflow.
Ingest and model data from diverse sources including GA4, event streams, and internal platforms.
Build well-structured fact and dimension tables to enable granular analytics and personalization.




Ensure Data Accuracy and Trust




Implement automated data validation, anomaly detection, and backfill systems.
Monitor and improve pipeline reliability and data transparency.




Enable Analytics & Product Experimentation




Collaborate with analysts, product managers, and CRO teams to turn business questions into scalable solutions.
Support and enhance our A/B testing infrastructure (segmentation, statistical testing, lift calculations).




Optimize for Scale and Efficiency




Tune workflows for performance and cost-efficiency using tools like Airflow / Cloud Composer.
Identify opportunities for optimization across storage, compute, and orchestration.
Promote a Data-Driven Culture
Develop self-serve dashboards and semantic models using Looker (or similar BI tools).
Champion best practices for data modeling, versioning, and CI/CD for analytics workflows.




What we are looking for:




Core Skills




3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role.
Strong SQL and Python skills; experience with data modeling and pipeline development.
Solid understanding of the Google Cloud Platform ecosystem (BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Storage).
Hands-on experience with tools like dbt, Airflow, Spark, or equivalent.




Analytics & Experimentation




Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies, including statistical significance and uplift measurement.
Experience working with analytics or data science teams on experiments or models.




Collaboration & Communication




Strong cross-functional communication skills ‚Äî able to align with product, engineering, and business teams.
Capable of explaining complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.




Bonus points:




Experience with Looker or other modern BI tools.
Familiarity with CI/CD for data pipelines and infrastructure-as-code tools.




Join us for:




Impact: Shape the data backbone of a global-scale product used by millions.
Growth: Expand your skills across cloud architecture, data engineering, and experimentation.
Culture: Join a collaborative, data-driven team that values innovation, autonomy, and technical excellence.

Title: Digital Factory - Technical Support Analyst
Description:
The opportunity

We are looking for an experienced senior technical support analyst who will be part of our amazing team. Our Digital factory team is driving a large portfolio of projects helping our different Service Lines in EY to build software applications/solutions through cutting edge technologies. As a senior technical support analyst, you will be responsible for supporting various developed applications and continuously bringing improvements in the automation. The responsibilities include writing code, analyzing data, and contributing to the design and supporting the application. You will be working directly with our stakeholders and will be responsible from all aspects of production application support.

Your Key Responsibilities


Supporting RPA (Blue prism), VBA, SQL and power BI applications in production for Tax service lines
Incident and service request management on daily basis for the mentioned technologies
Assist in the logging, tracking, and resolution of incidents and problems
Providing root cause analysis and weekly reporting of these incidents
Maintain and update service management documentation, including policies, procedures, and user guides
Contribute to the creation and maintenance of a knowledge base for service management
Ensure quality and smooth scheduling/running of automated processes in production
Work closely with other team members and departments to ensure seamless service delivery
Taking responsibility ensuring change control and change management procedures are followed while deploying/fixing things in production
Participate in service improvement initiatives and projects
Gather and analyze feedback from users to identify areas for improvement
Ensure a high level of customer satisfaction through effective communication and resolution of issues


Qualify for the role, you must have


3-4 years‚Äô experience of experience working on similar position in a corporate organization
A degree in Computer Science or a related discipline or a degree in business with technology consulting or technical experiences
Good hands-on experience in RPA (Blue prism), VBA , SQL and powerBI
Good knowledge in application support
Good knowledge and understanding of ITIL Incident, Problem and Change management process
Familiarity with agile development methodologies
You are interested in the connection between IT and process improvement / re-engineering
You are organized, flexible and able to manage several tasks
Excellent communication in English (French will be considered as an asset) and Excellent interpersonal skills
You are a team player and have excellent technical & analytical skills
Experience with PowerApps will be considered as an asset
Experience in Tax will be considered as an asset
Ability to remain calm and patient when dealing with repetitive inquiries
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


What We Offer


Dynamic teamwork: You‚Äôll work with brilliant and innovative professionals who are devoted to building a better working world
Continuous learning: You‚Äôll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next
Success as defined by you: We‚Äôll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way
Transformative leadership: We‚Äôll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs
Diverse and inclusive culture: You‚Äôll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

The exceptional EY experience. It‚Äôs yours to build.

Apply now.

Title: 2025 Business Intelligence Engineer Internship
Description:
Description

We‚Äôre on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you‚Äôre ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.

How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you‚Äôll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow

2025 Business Intelligence Engineer Internship- Luxemburg - Students with a graduation date in 2026

Do you enjoy solving complex problems and troubleshooting products? Are you passionate about developing test strategies, finding, and tracking bugs to resolution, and innovating on behalf of customers? Do you want to be a part of a fast-paced, ambiguous environment and contribute to one of the most visited sites on the Internet?

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world‚Äôs most beloved brands ‚Äì customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Business intelligence engineers use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand.

The challenges business intelligence engineers solve for at Amazon are big and affect millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. Our path is not always simple, so we are selective about who joins us on this journey. There is a certain kind of person who takes on this role at Amazon ‚Äì someone who is excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

The Amazon University Talent Acquisition Team are looking for ambitious students to join us as interns at the heart of our core consumer business! Internships are flexible in length to fit in with your university‚Äôs placement scheme.

Key job responsibilities


Develop analytical solutions to business problems that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity
Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Write high quality code to retrieve and analyze data
Analyze and solve business problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context
Design pragmatic analyses and automated metrics that add value to your business area
Understand data resources and how, when, and what to use (and what not to use).
Develop analyses (whether fully formed or exploratory) for the business‚Äô sake, not for analyses‚Äô sake
Seek to understand the business objectives relevant to your area, and align your work to those objectives and seek to deliver business value
Proactively and continually, improve your level of knowledge about Amazon‚Äôs business and relevant data resources


A day in the life

Our Business Intelligence Engineer builds data pipelines, reports, dashboards, and analyses to deliver metrics and insights to the business.

Our Business Intelligence Engineers tackle some of the most complex challenges in large scale

computing, work in small teams across the company to contribute to the e-commerce platform that's used by millions of people all over the world. With that in mind, we require applicants to demonstrate their technical skills in a number of areas.

About The Team

If you‚Äôre insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you‚Äôve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.


Competitive pay
Impactful project and internship/role deliverables
Hybrid working (team dependent)
Networking opportunities with fellow interns
Internships events such as speaker series, intern panels, Leadership Principles sessions, Amazon writing skills sessions.
Mentorship and career development


If you‚Äôre successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies.

Internship start dates vary throughout the year.

Internship length is ideally 6 months.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work.

Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers

Basic Qualifications


Work 40 hours/week minimum and commit to 6 to 12 month internship maximum
Are enrolled in a Bachelor's degree
Experience with SQL
Experience with programming languages such as Python, Java, C++
Experience in the data/BI space
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools


Preferred Qualifications


Knowledge of data modeling and data pipeline design
Are enrolled in a Master's degree


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

At Amazon, we hire the best minds in technology to innovate on behalf of our customers. The intense focus we have on our customers is why we are one of the world‚Äôs most beloved brands ‚Äì customer obsession is part of our company DNA. Business intelligence engineers use cutting-edge technology to solve complex problems and get to see the impact of their work first-hand.

The challenges business intelligence engineers solve for at Amazon are big and affect millions of customers, sellers, and products around the world. Our path is not always simple, so we are selective about who joins us on this journey. There is a certain kind of person who takes on this role at Amazon ‚Äì someone who is excited by the idea of creating new products, features, and services from scratch while managing ambiguity and the pace of a company whose ship cycles are measured in weeks, not years.

The Amazon University Talent Acquisition Team are looking for ambitious students to join us as interns at the heart of our core consumer business! Internships are flexible in length to fit in with your university‚Äôs placement scheme.

Key job responsibilities

  • Develop analytical solutions to business problems that utilize the highest standards of analytical rigor and data integrity
  • Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
  • Write high quality code to retrieve and analyze data
  • Analyze and solve business problems at their root, stepping back to understand the broader context
  • Design pragmatic analyses and automated metrics that add value to your business area
  • Understand data resources and how, when, and what to use (and what not to use).
  • Develop analyses (whether fully formed or exploratory) for the business‚Äô sake, not for analyses‚Äô sake
  • Seek to understand the business objectives relevant to your area, and align your work to those objectives and seek to deliver business value
  • Proactively and continually, improve your level of knowledge about Amazon‚Äôs business and relevant data resources

A day in the life

Our Business Intelligence Engineer builds data pipelines, reports, dashboards, and analyses to deliver metrics and insights to the business.

Our Business Intelligence Engineers tackle some of the most complex challenges in large scale

computing, work in small teams across the company to contribute to the e-commerce platform that's used by millions of people all over the world. With that in mind, we require applicants to demonstrate their technical skills in a number of areas.

About The Team

If you‚Äôre insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you‚Äôve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.

  • Competitive pay
  • Impactful project and internship/role deliverables
  • Hybrid working (team dependent)
  • Networking opportunities with fellow interns
  • Internships events such as speaker series, intern panels, Leadership Principles sessions, Amazon writing skills sessions.
  • Mentorship and career development

If you‚Äôre successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies.

Internship start dates vary throughout the year.

Internship length is ideally 6 months.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work.

Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers

Basic Qualifications

  • Work 40 hours/week minimum and commit to 6 to 12 month internship maximum
  • Are enrolled in a Bachelor's degree
  • Experience with SQL
  • Experience with programming languages such as Python, Java, C++
  • Experience in the data/BI space
  • Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of data modeling and data pipeline design
  • Are enrolled in a Master's degree

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon EU SARL

Job ID: A2793105

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE‚Äôs assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group‚Äôs large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 expertises:


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The applicant will join the "Digital and Data Accelerator" (DDA) team. The primary objective of this team is to develop high-quality data products for our clients, focusing on critical areas such as fundamental data collection, historical asset data compilation, and production and consumption forecasting models. This initiative plays a vital role in optimizing resource allocation and advancing decarbonization efforts. The DDA team engages in various strategic activities, including the development and rationalization of data projects, ensuring robust data governance, and maintaining high data quality standards. We collaborate closely with the GEMS business unit to enhance data utilization efficiency. Furthermore, the team is tasked with structuring and piloting the data strategy within GEMS, reinforcing governance practices, and implementing a cohesive data architecture. Role: Working hand in hand with business and IT teams, the Data Engineer will:


Design, develop, and maintain data pipelines.
Ensure the availability and quality of data.
Optimize the performance of data processing systems.
Interact with data scientists to understand their needs and adapt pipelines accordingly.
Implement best development practices and monitor production systems.


Particular care will be necessary to:


Manage large volumes of data.
Optimize pipeline performance.
Ensure code maintainability.
Quickly resolve incidents.
Continuously improve existing systems.


Hard skills:


Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Proficiency in big data frameworks such as Spark and Databricks.
Experience with data pipeline tools and ETL processes.
Good knowledge of cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, in particular AWS S3, Glue, Athena or equivalent.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and best practices.
DevOps, infra as code, continuous integration and delivery concepts.
Agile methodology.


Soft skills:


Strong problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking.
Excellent communication skills to effectively collaborate with data scientists and other team members.
Ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality work.


Education and professional background:


Master‚Äôs degree in engineering with a proven specialty in IT or equivalent.
Previous experience in the implementation and customization of data pipelines


Languages:


Language: English as a working language
Language: French Mandatory


Travels:


Occasional travels to Brussels are expected


If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals.

All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (‚Äúraison d‚Äô√™tre‚Äù) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Division: GEMS - EC IS

Legal Entity: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH

Professional Experience: Skilled ( >3 experience <15 years)

Education Level: Master's Degree

Title: Experienced Junior Business and Data analyst - Audit Transformation
Description:
Your future team

At Deloitte Luxembourg, we are proud to present a unique and exciting opportunity within our newly created team: Data Processing in the Audit Transformation department. If you have a background that combines accounting expertise with a passion for data analytics, this role is tailor-made for you!

Our mission is to elevate audit quality by focusing on what truly matters while liberating our audit teams from the tedious task of manual data manipulation and analysis. As a Business and Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of revolutionizing the audit process. Your expertise in accounting will complement your data analytics skills, allowing you to bridge the gap between traditional audit practices and cutting-edge data-driven insights.

Your next challenge


Develop Alteryx scripts to automate critical audit processes, significantly enhancing efficiency and saving valuable hours for the audit team letting them focus on the things that matter the most.
Collaborate with a dynamic and diverse team, fostering innovation and creativity.
Review and optimize scripts, ensuring the highest data accuracy and integrity.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation to support audit teams seamlessly.
Create and design data visualizations to enhance the audit documentation and analytics for the audit teams,
Communicate directly with audit teams, gaining a deep understanding of their needs and requirements.


Moreover, you'll join an organization committed to your professional development and growth. We encourage you to be imaginative, to explore new avenues, and to contribute your unique ideas towards shaping the future of audit. Our team is not just about the work; it's about your personal and professional journey.

In addition to a competitive compensation package and the opportunity to work with leading experts in the field, this role offers the chance to be a part of something ground-breaking. Deloitte Luxembourg is dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what is possible in audit, and your mixed background in accounting and data analytics will play a pivotal role in driving this transformation forward.

Don't miss this chance to be at the forefront of the audit revolution, where your skills and ideas are not only valued but also integral to our success.

Your Skills


Experience with Alteryx or other analytics automation software
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel (and Office Suite)
Experience in accounting/audit positions
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI and Tableau
More than 1 year of work experience applying the mentioned skills
Optional: Experience with entry-level coding (Python) is a plus


Join us and...


Perfect your competencies with a tailor-made training plan, exploiting our induction programme
Benefit from a complementary health insurance, conciergerie services, car leasing possibilities and much more‚Ä¶
Profit from our Global network for career opportunities
Enjoy and promote diversity in our multicultural teams


What impact will you make?

Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. Deloitte is where you will find unrivalled opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

Our global standards enable us to deliver consistent, exceptional services across the globe, whilst continuously developing our Talents. Click here to discover what is expected from you in this role.

Get to know more about Deloitte; Facebook page, LinkedIn page or website.

Deloitte Luxembourg, with around 2,700 employees and with more than 80 nationalities, is a member of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, one of the world's leading professional services firms in audit, tax, financial advisory and consulting. Every day our multidisciplinary teams work together to offer innovative solutions to our clients' complex issues. At the heart of Europe, Luxembourg is a cosmopolitan economic center. The thriving diverse cultural life, the many sporting activities and its vast open spaces make Luxembourg unique and a great place to live.

Join us in enabling a diverse and inclusive environment for all!

Diversity and inclusion bring great value to our profession and community, and build our ability to deliver truly differentiated solutions and experiences to our clients. Deloitte is committed to creating and supporting a culture of inclusion that empowers all of our people to be at their best on both a personal and professional level.


Show more

Title: Database Engineer
Description:
Task Responsibilities:


Manage, secure, and optimize database solutions, ensuring their availability, performance, and compliance with security standards.
Plan, implement, and configure data platform resources, including database authentication, authorization, and automation of tasks using Azure DevOps orchestration.
Monitor and optimize database resources and query performance, while also planning and configuring high availability and disaster recovery (HA/DR) environments.
Perform backup and restore operations, apply patches and updates for PaaS and IaaS deployments, and recommend appropriate database types, offerings, data models, table partitioning, and sharding solutions.
Maintain the IT ticketing system and knowledge base, staying up to date with infrastructure technology standards.
Collaborate with support, technology, project teams, and IT management to improve IT services, documenting tasks in Azure DevOps and ServiceNow.
Coordinate with IT and business application owners to upgrade database versions, enhance cloud-based database solutions, and monitor backups and performance.
Prepare and execute backup and recovery jobs in collaboration with IT and business stakeholders, ensuring databases align with IT infrastructure and business application requirements.
Provide comprehensive database support in partnership with various teams, including data engineers, data scientists, and other professionals, managing and optimizing databases while adhering to least privileged access and ‚Äúzero trust‚Äù principles.
Participate in the design and implementation of new application releases, focusing on database integration and optimization, and serve as a database expert for new information systems.
Minimize operational costs of database resources while maintaining required performance levels, and maintain high security standards targeting compliance with NIS 2 and ISO 270001 standards.
Provide 24/7 support for business-critical systems by participating in the on-call escalation team on a rotational basis.


Essential Requirements For The Position:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven work experience in IT support services management or a similar role.
Proven experience with Oracle and/or SQL.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with clients and team members.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Proactive attitude and ability to take initiative.
Fluent in English; proficiency in additional languages is considered an asset.
Ability to design and optimize data management solutions for various applications.


Working Conditions:


Permanent contract.
Full-time position based in our HQ in Luxembourg.
Occasional travel required.
The position holder might have to be an stand-by outside the normal office hours and weekends in case of incidents.
Standard office hours are to be expected Monday - Friday.
A Certificate of good conduct (Casier judiciaire, Polizeiliches F√ºhrungszeugnis) will be required in case of a positive selection.

Title: Technology, Artificial Intelligence Internship ‚Äì Research & Development (6 Months starting July/August 2025)
Company: Revantage Europe, A Blackstone Portfolio Company
Description:
Overview

Who We Are

Revantage Europe is a professional corporate services company that embraces ambition and innovation to service Blackstone‚Äôs European real estate investments.

Blackstone is the world‚Äôs largest alternative asset manager, with a real estate portfolio that includes industrial & logistics, residential, office, hospitality and retail properties in North America, Europe, Asia, Australia and New Zealand.

What We Value - Our Culture

Creating a culture that inspires change and momentum requires the right team. We know what it takes to lead an industry, and are looking for leaders who seek constant growth, want to excel, and continuously improve upon themselves and the industry.

The culture at Revantage is built on our shared core values and commitment to be:


Achievers ‚Äì We expect high standards for ourselves and enable the success of our teams.
Enthusiasts - We face challenges with optimism and believe anything is possible.
Leaders - We commit to continuously improve our performance.
Learners ‚Äì We learn from our challenges, successes and the diversity of our people.
Partners - We deliver value and positive impact to our partners.



Why This Internship Is Valuable

As an AI and Generative AI Intern, you will work closely with our experienced engineers to develop and optimize AI models, conduct research, and implement generative AI solutions. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Responsibilities


AI Model Development: Assist in building and optimizing machine learning models, ensuring they meet project requirements. Participate in the preprocessing of datasets and data cleaning to improve the performance of AI models.
Research and Data Analysis: Perform research on current AI trends, technologies, and best practices. Analyze and process large datasets to extract meaningful insights for AI model development.
Generative AI Projects: Contribute to the development of generative AI models and tools, leveraging large language models (LLMs) for real-world applications.
Testing and Evaluation: Assist in testing AI models to ensure they are functioning as expected. Identify and address potential issues or inaccuracies in AI systems.
Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, end users, and other teams to align AI solutions with business goals. Contribute ideas and insights during team meetings.
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed records of AI experiments, model development processes, and results. Assist in preparing reports and presentations summarizing the outcomes of AI research or experiments.
Prototyping and Experimentation: Design and develop proof-of-concept applications, collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into business processes.



Qualifications

What You Bring to the Role


Current Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science.
Proficiency in programming languages in Python or R, C#, C++, Java is a plus.
Must have knowledge of AI/ML libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn is as plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods, linear algebra, and calculus to develop and evaluate machine learning models.
Familiarity with data manipulation, cleaning, and preprocessing techniques using libraries such as Pandas or Numpy.
Ability to conduct thorough research on AI and generative AI trends and technologies.
Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to document and present research findings clearly and concisely.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to team goals.
Fluency in English, French or German is a plus.
Previous internship or project experience in AI or machine learning.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.



DIVERSITY MAKES US SMARTER

With an exceptionally high number of nationalities and spoken languages we‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone ‚Äî diversity and inclusion is the DNA of Revantage Europe. With an average of 3 languages fluently spoken per employee, this unique blend is a real competitive advantage that helps us support Blackstone Real Estate across the European jurisdictions. Thanks to our diversity, we are flexible and able to adapt our response to the challenges we face.
Show more
