What We Value - Our Culture

Creating a culture that inspires change and momentum requires the right team. We know what it takes to lead an industry, and are looking for leaders who seek constant growth, want to excel, and continuously improve upon themselves and the industry.

The culture at Revantage is built on our shared core values and commitment to be:

  • Achievers ‚Äì We expect high standards for ourselves and enable the success of our teams.
  • Enthusiasts - We face challenges with optimism and believe anything is possible.
  • Leaders - We commit to continuously improve our performance.
  • Learners ‚Äì We learn from our challenges, successes and the diversity of our people.
  • Partners - We deliver value and positive impact to our partners.


Why This Internship Is Valuable

As an AI and Generative AI Intern, you will work closely with our experienced engineers to develop and optimize AI models, conduct research, and implement generative AI solutions. This internship offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a dynamic and innovative environment.

Responsibilities

  • AI Model Development: Assist in building and optimizing machine learning models, ensuring they meet project requirements. Participate in the preprocessing of datasets and data cleaning to improve the performance of AI models.
  • Research and Data Analysis: Perform research on current AI trends, technologies, and best practices. Analyze and process large datasets to extract meaningful insights for AI model development.
  • Generative AI Projects: Contribute to the development of generative AI models and tools, leveraging large language models (LLMs) for real-world applications.
  • Testing and Evaluation: Assist in testing AI models to ensure they are functioning as expected. Identify and address potential issues or inaccuracies in AI systems.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with engineers, end users, and other teams to align AI solutions with business goals. Contribute ideas and insights during team meetings.
  • Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed records of AI experiments, model development processes, and results. Assist in preparing reports and presentations summarizing the outcomes of AI research or experiments.
  • Prototyping and Experimentation: Design and develop proof-of-concept applications, collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate AI solutions into business processes.


Qualifications

What You Bring to the Role

  • Current Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science.
  • Proficiency in programming languages in Python or R, C#, C++, Java is a plus.
  • Must have knowledge of AI/ML libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn is as plus.
  • Basic understanding of statistical methods, linear algebra, and calculus to develop and evaluate machine learning models.
  • Familiarity with data manipulation, cleaning, and preprocessing techniques using libraries such as Pandas or Numpy.
  • Ability to conduct thorough research on AI and generative AI trends and technologies.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to document and present research findings clearly and concisely.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to team goals.
  • Fluency in English, French or German is a plus.
  • Previous internship or project experience in AI or machine learning.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.


DIVERSITY MAKES US SMARTER

With an exceptionally high number of nationalities and spoken languages we‚Äôre committed to building a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone ‚Äî diversity and inclusion is the DNA of Revantage Europe. With an average of 3 languages fluently spoken per employee, this unique blend is a real competitive advantage that helps us support Blackstone Real Estate across the European jurisdictions. Thanks to our diversity, we are flexible and able to adapt our response to the challenges we face.

Title: Senior Data Engineer (m/f/x)
Description:
Position Overview

For over 150 years, our dedication to being the Global Hausbank for our clients has been driven by our people ‚Äì in around 60 countries and across more than 150 nationalities.

Their deep understanding, insights, expertise, and passion help our clients navigate an increasingly complex world ‚Äì be it in our Corporate Bank, our Private Bank, our Investment Bank or our Asset Management division.

Together we can make a great impact for our clients home and abroad, securing their lasting success and financial security.

Deutsche Bank Technology, Data and Innovation (TDI) is looking for a senior technical analyst in Luxembourg to join our Data & Analytics team. We provide access to high-quality data, analytics and reporting services, as well as expertise to meet the data demand of our clients and to ensure compliance to data governance standards within the Private Bank.

We are looking for a person who has the drive and the ability to understand the business processes and technical side, and transform this knowledge into processes that move the data from source systems into our local data warehouse and further on into consuming applications.

Responsibilities


Understand data requirements from a content and technical perspective and drive data discovery, sourcing and analytics for the creation of data flows and models in Oracle (in future on GCP).
Research in banking platform and databases, constructing complex SQL queries across data categories such as banking & investment products, transactions, performance.
Prepare functional specifications including data selection criteria to developers; and perform testing of the results.
Design appropriate data quality controls and ensure their implementation.
Analyze issues reported by data consumers in the database (e.g., for erroneous data, missing data) to detect functional issues.



The successful candidate will be asked to present a recent criminal record.

Skills


Experience in IT data analysis, data warehouse principles, SQL as well as understanding of PL/SQL.
Good knowledge of Wealth Management products, services and processes.
Solid and proven expertise in banking platforms such as Avaloq from a functional and technical perspective.
Ability to write data mapping, data dictionary and data transformation documents.
Excellent English, written and spoken.



Well-being & Benefits


Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as training events, counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health. Reach out to our Mental Health First Aiders.
Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. We offer an in-house gym, standing desks, medical check-ups and promote healthier ways of working.
Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self-confidence and well-being. Our local benefits vary from different types of leave, sports groups to engage with colleagues while keeping physically active and a hybrid working model.
Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Thus, we offer two pension contribution plans, a worldwide accident insurance, private insurance discounts, special conditions as a Deutsche Bank employee with several retail banks in Luxembourg, public transportation reimbursement, lunch voucher scheme, company car participation, as well as a Corporate Benefits platform



Wir streben eine Unternehmenskultur an, in der wir gemeinsam jeden Tag das Beste geben. Dazu geh√∂ren verantwortungsvolles Handeln, wirtschaftliches Denken, Initiative ergreifen und zielgerichtete Zusammenarbeit.

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Wir begr√º√üen Bewerbungen von allen Menschen und f√∂rdern ein positives, faires und integratives Arbeitsumfeld.

Title: Database Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about IT development and eager to make a significant impact? We invite you to become a part of our IT Applications & Integration department, where you'll play a crucial role in supporting, maintaining, and integrating software packages into our comprehensive Information System. Dive into exciting data flows and reporting projects, and thrive in a collaborative environment that values your growth and expertise.




Your tasks and responsibilities:




Conduct detailed technical analyses and document IT developments.
Design, analyze impacts, and code programs following UI efa standards.
Define and organize unit and integration tests.
Ensure smooth production implementation.
Manage corrective and evolutionary maintenance.
Administer applications in your domain, focusing on performance, availability, and security.
Lead internal meetings with team members and project stakeholders.
Participate in IT on-call duties as required.




Your skills and experience:




Enthusiastic about IT development in data flows and reporting.
Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science with 2-3 years of relevant experience.
Proficient in procedural programming, SQL, and database modeling.
Skills in Oracle SQL / PL-SQL and reporting tools like SAP BI or Crystal Reports would be of benefit.
Proven success in IT projects within Fund Accounting or Transfer Agency domains.
Solution-oriented with excellent user interaction skills.
Fluent in French with good English proficiency.
Enjoys teamwork and can work independently.




We offer you:




An exciting working environment and challenging tasks
Extensive insight into the European fund industry
Friendly, international and goal-oriented working environment
High degree of independent work
Varied work as part of a dynamic and ambitious company that has been established in the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg for more than 25 years
An attractive remuneration scheme: Company Agreement, min. 34.5 days‚Äô leave, meal vouchers, life and disability insurance, pension scheme, interest subsidies, etc.




Join us and leverage your technical and functional competencies in a supportive and growth-oriented environment!

Title: Business Application Support Analyst - CDD 12 months
Description:
About Lombard International Assurance

Lombard International Assurance is a leading Luxembourg-based provider of insurance-based wealth solutions across Europe. A part of Utmost Group, Lombard International‚Äôs solutions are largely based on unit-linked insurance policies, serving the needs of affluent, high net worth (HNW), and ultra-high net worth (UHNW) individuals.

On 30 December 2024, Utmost Group announced it had completed the acquisition of Lombard International Assurance Holdings Sarl and the company will be fully rebranded to Utmost Luxembourg S.A. by the end of 2025.

About Utmost Group Plc

Utmost Group plc is a leading provider of insurance and savings solutions. Its principal businesses are Utmost international and Utmost Life and Pensions, which together are responsible for ¬£109bn of primarily unit-linked policyholder assets for 5000,000 policyholders, on a proforma basis at HY 2024 following the acquisition of Lombard International Assurance Holding Sarl. Utmost Group plc is subject to group supervision by the PRA.

About Utmost International

Utmost International is a leading provider of insurance-based wealth solutions. Utmost international operates across the UK, Europe Latin America; Asia, and the Middle East. Its solutions are largely based on unit-linked insurance policies, serving the needs of affluent, high net worth (HNW), and ultra-high net worth (UHNW) individuals.

On a proforma basis at HY 2024 following the acquisition of Lombard International Assurance Holdings Sarl, Utmost International would have managed ¬£103bn of assets under administration on behalf of approximately 210,000 policyholders.

Your role ‚Äì Are you ready for a challenge?

The Business Application Support Analyst is responsible for ensuring the smooth functioning and availability of core software applications by providing technical assistance, troubleshooting, and resolving issues. This involves ITSM proactive monitoring, timely response to incidents, continuous improvement of processes, and effective communication with stakeholders to minimize downtime and maximize user satisfaction

Your Responsibilities Will Be As Follows

Incident Management & Troubleshooting:


Acknowledge, categorize, and prioritize incoming incidents and requests in the ITSM system
Ensure accurate and comprehensive documentation of incidents and resolutions
Resolve incidents within agreed Service Level Agreements (SLAs) or escalate appropriately


Business Application Support


Develop a thorough understanding of business applications and their usage
Provide daily IT support and clear analysis of application-related issues
Establish strong relationships with business users to understand their needs and improve support


Proactive System Monitoring & Improvement


Identify and escalate potential system issues to prevent business disruptions
Suggest and support process improvements and technology upgrades
Maintain compliance with best practices, security policies, and industry regulation


Collaboration & Reporting


Communicate effectively with stakeholders, including IT teams and business users.
Provide regular progress reports on incident resolution and system performance.
Share knowledge and support continuous learning within the IT team.
Providing day to day IT business support and progress reports to our internal clients related to business applications and IT technical issues


Your profile ‚Äì Have you got what it takes to become our Business Application Support Analyst?


Minimum 3-5 years in insurance or financial services;
Experience in a similar application support role;
Solid understanding of IT landscapes, as well as its business applications;
Troubleshooting techniques;
Knowledge of SQL language is an asset;
Being able to interpret data;
Log analysis reviewing, interpreting, and understanding logs generated by systems, networks, and applications (Pattern Recognition, Anomaly Detection, Root Cause Analysis‚Ä¶);
Familiarity with IT Service Management systems (e.g., ServiceNow) is a plus;
ITIL Foundation, SCRUM, Agile certification (or equivalent) is an asset;
Training and understanding of regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, DORA, CAA, CSSF);
Familiarity with incident management methodologies (e.g., 5W);
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
Ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment;
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) in English;
French, German, and Luxembourgish are advantageous;
Customer-focused mindset with a proactive approach;
Team player with the ability to work collaboratively across departments.


We offer you

Sitting at the crossroads of private banking, asset management and insurance, we operate in a well-established and fast-growing segment of the financial services industry. We offer a thriving and entrepreneurial work environment, with the opportunity to work across multiple geographies, learn valuable new skills, develop great expertise, and establish long-lasting relationships. It is an exciting opportunity to build a network of contacts across the organisation in a collaborative and diverse workplace. Our Luxembourg office is home to a diverse team of over 50 nationalities and we are always looking for exceptional talent to join our team. Because our people are our greatest assets, you will enjoy reward and recognition packages. We also offer you the possibility to shape your professional career in line with your own goals and the opportunity to work with the top talent in the industry. We are committed to extending equal employment opportunities to all individuals.

Be a part of our community! #utmost

As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, colour, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Given the sensitive nature of our business, industry sector and the role as described, the selected candidate is required to provide a criminal record (Bulletin n¬∞3 for Luxembourgish residents). This excerpt will be kept by Lombard International Assurance S.A. in compliance with article 8-5 (2) of the law of 23 July 2016 and for no longer than one month from the conclusion of the employment contract; otherwise, it will be destroyed without any undue delay should the candidate not be hired.

Should you be interested in pursuing this opportunity, please send your application in full confidence to Lombard International Assurance S.A, https://www.lombardinternational.com/en-US/Careers/Job-Board

Lombard International Assurance is aware of its obligations under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and is committed to processing your data securely and transparently.

Our Recruitment privacy notice is in line with GDPR and provides more information with regards to the types of data that we collect and hold on you as a job applicant, including for the performance of Background Checks. It also sets out how we use that information, how long we keep it for and other relevant information about your data. For full details please click here Recruitment Privacy Statement

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer , Transportation Network Design Insights
Description:
Description

Amazon ships millions of packages every day, from hundreds of origins to hundreds of destinations. In this role, your goal is to extract the most important insights out of those package flows and extract the most important findings to our most senior leaders.

You will answer questions like "Where do we spend too much?", or "Where are we too slow?", or "Where do we have inefficient, carbon-intensive routes?".

Your goal is to be a force-multiplier for your internal customers, and help business leaders drive decisions and projects forward on a global scale, from inception to implementation.

Here's Why You Will Love Working With Us


You'll get a view behind the scenes of the world's most impressive transportation network
You will take ownership of real problems with big impact (we measure impact in the 10s of million $), driving them from conception to completion
You'll learn and grow rapidly, developing skills that will propel your career forward
You'll collaborate with a team of innovative thinkers and experts in their field, always pushing boundaries
You'll use technology and advanced analytics to solve complex, real-world problems
You'll contribute directly to a mission that affects millions of customers worldwide
You'll be able to explore new areas when the upside is large enough (we define our own destiny)
Amazon's data will be your playground


Key job responsibilities

As a Business Intelligence Engineer, You Will


Work directly with senior leaders to provide the data and insights for their biggest problems
Dive Deep into these problems, auditing the systems we use and finding the right data in datasets with billions of entries
Define and build new metrics that accurately describe the performance of our network, isolating the impact of different factors contributing to the performance
Continuously streamline and automate reporting and analytical processes for others to self-serve
Build scalable solutions that can be re-used to drive fast, repeatable decisions
Use Python, SQL and AWS Services to create, automate, visualize and optimize solutions
Work jointly with your teammates and key business partners, communicating your results to senior leaders in the company and influencing the goals they set
Refine the technical standards for the rest of the team, bringing structure and standardization to elevate everyone's impact


A day in the life

No 2 days are the same, but you'd probably do a mix of the following things


Meeting with a business stakeholder to understand the problem to solve
Deep-dive a few examples of the problem, going deep into Amazon systems and data
Build a prototype of a solution for the problem
Measure the impact of the solution after implementing
Scaling and automation the prototype to a repeatable tool
Present your findings to business and tech leadership


About The Team

Network Design Insights is a diverse group of problem-solvers, tool builders, and innovators. Our mission is to ensure customers receive their packages faster, cheaper, more reliably and more sustainably, making adjustments to Amazon's European transportation network. We run large-scale programs, and design and develop systems that scale Amazon's decision-making processes through automation. We have profiles of Business Intelligence, Program Management and Process Improvement. We embrace a culture of learning, collaboration, and innovation, constantly pushing boundaries to deliver the best solutions.

Basic Qualifications


Experience in scripting for automation (e.g. Python) and advanced SQL skills.
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
Experience using Cloud Storage and Computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Hadoop, etc.
Experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs
Experience managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership
Experience building measures and metrics, and developing reporting solutions


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with operations/supply chain
Experience with AWS technologies
Knowledge of data warehousing and data modeling


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon EU Sarl

  • Amazon's data will be your playground

Key job responsibilities

As a Business Intelligence Engineer, You Will

  • Work directly with senior leaders to provide the data and insights for their biggest problems
  • Dive Deep into these problems, auditing the systems we use and finding the right data in datasets with billions of entries
  • Define and build new metrics that accurately describe the performance of our network, isolating the impact of different factors contributing to the performance
  • Continuously streamline and automate reporting and analytical processes for others to self-serve
  • Build scalable solutions that can be re-used to drive fast, repeatable decisions
  • Use Python, SQL and AWS Services to create, automate, visualize and optimize solutions
  • Work jointly with your teammates and key business partners, communicating your results to senior leaders in the company and influencing the goals they set
  • Refine the technical standards for the rest of the team, bringing structure and standardization to elevate everyone's impact

A day in the life

No 2 days are the same, but you'd probably do a mix of the following things

  • Meeting with a business stakeholder to understand the problem to solve
  • Deep-dive a few examples of the problem, going deep into Amazon systems and data
  • Build a prototype of a solution for the problem
  • Measure the impact of the solution after implementing
  • Scaling and automation the prototype to a repeatable tool
  • Present your findings to business and tech leadership

About The Team

Network Design Insights is a diverse group of problem-solvers, tool builders, and innovators. Our mission is to ensure customers receive their packages faster, cheaper, more reliably and more sustainably, making adjustments to Amazon's European transportation network. We run large-scale programs, and design and develop systems that scale Amazon's decision-making processes through automation. We have profiles of Business Intelligence, Program Management and Process Improvement. We embrace a culture of learning, collaboration, and innovation, constantly pushing boundaries to deliver the best solutions.

Basic Qualifications

  • Experience in scripting for automation (e.g. Python) and advanced SQL skills.
  • Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
  • Experience using Cloud Storage and Computing technologies such as AWS Redshift, S3, Hadoop, etc.
  • Experience working directly with business stakeholders to translate between data and business needs
  • Experience managing, analyzing and communicating results to senior leadership
  • Experience building measures and metrics, and developing reporting solutions

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with operations/supply chain
  • Experience with AWS technologies
  • Knowledge of data warehousing and data modeling

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.


Company - Amazon EU Sarl

Title: Data Engineer - Local to Pittsburgh/Dallas/Birmingham/Phoenix/Cleveland
Description:
We‚Äôre growing rapidly and are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team and help us develop and deploy enterprise-grade platforms that enable data-driven solutions. This role is more than automating and maintaining scalable infrastructure, though. At CGI, you‚Äôll make an impact for some of the largest organizations and brands in the world while enjoying unparalleled career growth in the process.

We‚Äôre a close-knit team that has access to global resources. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to explore a wide range of industries, technologies, and geographies, all while enjoying the personal touch that our local operating approach offers.

Growth at CGI is driven by your goals, so if you‚Äôre looking for an inclusive place where you‚Äôre empowered to chart your own path, then we‚Äôd love to meet you.

Your future duties and responsibilities


Design various enterprise information and data and analytics strategies, including defining visions, conducting assessments of people, processes, and technology; and developing dynamic business value roadmaps.
Design and implement modern industry best practices in governance, management, and quality of information/data.
Design and implementation of data quality scorecards and metrics.
Evaluation, selection and implementation of tools and technology for data catalogs, data governance, data quality and data management.
Collaborate with business and technical teams to provide direction for and contribute to development, implementation and rollout of solutions and consulting services.
Facilitate design and solution workshops with clients


Required Qualifications To Be Successful In This Role

5-7 years experience in:


ML & Data Engineering pipelines
Hadoop
Python with Django and Flask, Spark, Big-Data stack - Hive, Kafka & NoSQL's
Analytical Skill set
Machine Learning ready dataset
Design, implementation of applications using GraphQL and No SQL
Feature Engineering


CGI is required by law in some jurisdictions to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. The determination of this range includes various factors not limited to skill set, level, experience, relevant training, and licensure and certifications. To support the ability to reward for merit-based performance, CGI typically does not hire individuals at or near the top of the range for their role. Compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range for this role in the U.S. is 57,100 - $154,300.

Benefits

CGI's benefits are offered to eligible professionals on their first day of employment to include:

Competitive compensation

Comprehensive insurance options

Matching contributions through the 401(k) plan and the share purchase plan

Paid time off for vacation, holidays, and sick time

Paid parental leave

Learning opportunities and tuition assistance

Wellness and Well-being programs

Together, as owners, let‚Äôs turn meaningful insights into action.

Life at CGI is rooted in ownership, teamwork, respect and belonging. Here, you‚Äôll reach your full potential because‚Ä¶

You are invited to be an owner from day 1 as we work together to bring our Dream to life. That‚Äôs why we call ourselves CGI Partners rather than employees. We benefit from our collective success and actively shape our company‚Äôs strategy and direction.

Your work creates value. You‚Äôll develop innovative solutions and build relationships with teammates and clients while accessing global capabilities to scale your ideas, embrace new opportunities, and benefit from expansive industry and technology expertise.

You‚Äôll shape your career by joining a company built to grow and last. You‚Äôll be supported by leaders who care about your health and well-being and provide you with opportunities to deepen your skills and broaden your horizons.

Come join our team‚Äîone of the largest IT and business consulting services firms in the world.

Title: SQL Database Administrator
Description:
Salary: $80,000- $86,500 per year commensurate with experience

How To Apply

Applications are submitted online until the position is filled and/or the posting is closed. After reviewing this job announcement, please click on the link at the bottom of the page to apply online. A resume is required with the application. Further instructions on submission of documents are available in the online application. A resume may not be substituted for an application.

Minimum Requirements


High school diploma or equivalent AND six (6) years of SQL database experience including database design, development, and programming using stored procedures.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted.
Database creation, tuning, troubleshooting, and problem-solving are preferred.


It is the policy of Allegheny County that in order to receive a final offer of employment, candidates must successfully pass a background check, which includes verification of Allegheny County Real Estate Tax status.

Position Summary

Under the supervision of the Infrastructure Operations Supervisor, the SQL Database Administrator is responsible for the administration, maintenance, development, and implementation of policies and procedures for ensuring the security and integrity of County Databases.

Overview

Duties:


Leads SQL Server software installation, maintenance, and conversions.
Maintains multiple databases in development and production environments.
Works with development teams on all aspects of database design including tables, views, stored procedures, permissions, etc.
Performs logical database design and physical database implementations.
Creates tests and conducts performance tuning on databases.
Develops SQL processes for data loading, migration, and application interfaces.
Designs and implements backup and recovery strategies.
Creates deployment scripts, including rollback scripts for all database changes.
Monitors daily SQL processes for successful completion.
Troubleshoots production problems and be a key part of the first-level support team to investigate and resolve issues.
Performs security configuration and administration.
Develops and enforces organizational SQL standards and best practices.
Assists with project plans and may lead technical projects.
Communicates status, issues, and ideas to management.
Performs other duties as requested/required.


Knowledge Of

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities


Backup and recovery and database design and modeling.
Database creation, tuning, troubleshooting, and problem-solving preferred.
Configuration of hardware and software with the system administrators.
Security administration, database analysis, database design, and data modeling and optimization.


Skill In


SQL Server installation and maintenance, T-SQL, SQL, and scripting.
SQL Server Reporting Services.
SQL Integration Services, Visual Studio, and Business Intelligence Transformations in SSIS.
Microsoft Office Products.


Ability To


Work effectively with little supervision, both alone, and in a group.
Demonstrate strong interpersonal and creative skills, as well as the drive to meet real needs with technology.
Develop project specifications & time estimates.
Communicate effectively, orally and in writing.
Create informative technical documentation and guides.
Facilitate frequent meetings with client departments and vendors.
Work outside of normal business hours as needed or required.


Residency: Allegheny County within 1 year.

Veterans' Preference: Will be awarded to eligible candidates.

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER - M/F/V/D

Apply Online

Title: Data Center Specialist
Description:
Seneca Resources is currently recruiting for Data Center Specialists to join the Cloud team.

Essential Duties:

Rack, build, cable, configure, and provision Intel and Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) servers
Rack, cable, and deploy Cisco Layer 2 networking equipment
Troubleshoot, test, quality assurance of server hardware
Professionally resolve hardware issues via trouble ticket




Required Education

High School Diploma/GED




Preferred Education

Associate's Degree/College Diploma




Required technical and professional expertise

Requirements

Operating System Installation Windows Server, Linux, Unix
Rack, cable, and deploy Cisco Layer 2 networking equipment a plus
Web Server and Database installation experience a plus
Must be able to work in this country without company sponsorship
Must be fluent in English
Must be willing to learn quickly, multi-task, and work in a fast pace environment
Moderate knowledge of PC hardware concepts and component installation.
Basic knowledge of various internet-related services and software (mail, web, DNS, etc).
General understanding of computer networking concepts.
Customer focused attitude with some previous customer service experience.
Network wiring/cabling experience a plus




Preferred technical and professional experience

3-5 years‚Äô experience with Windows and Linux Platforms
3-5 years‚Äô experience with computer/server hardware
Certifications are not required but a plus.




About Seneca Resources:

Seneca Resources is client driven provider of strategic Information Technology consulting services and Workforce Solutions to government and industry. Seneca Resources is a leading IT services provider with offices in Reston, Virginia, Alabama and Columbia, Maryland that service clients throughout the United States. The key to our success lies within our strong corporate culture which drives our business. We challenge our staff through engaging work, and we reward our staff through competitive compensation, extensive professional training, and excellent opportunities for career advancement. In turn, we look for only the best and brightest to join our team. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value the benefits of diversity in our workplace.

Title: Reporting Coordinator
Description:
Benefits Coordinators Corporation (BCC) is a third-party employee benefits administrator and a leader in developing services designed to help our clients run more effective employee benefit programs. We are currently looking to add a Reporting Coordinator to the team. This is a great opportunity to start your career in a role where you can be trained by and work with some of the top experts in the industry.

Job Functions Include


Working on daily report processing (auditing/creation/distribution)
Completing inbound/outbound transactions files
Documentation of procedures and processes


Strength And Skills Necessary For Success In The Role


Previous experience with the Microsoft Suite (Excel, Outlook, Access, Word) will be helpful
1-2 years related office experience preferred
Prior experience with computer operations preferred


Our Pittsburgh (Robinson Township) location gives you the opportunity to be a part of a big organization, but to also have that small company feel. In addition, there are a number of opportunities for you to get involved, whether it is in projects for work or volunteer and social opportunities.

Pay & Benefits (Most Benefits Start Day 1)


Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
PTO/ Paid Holidays
401(k) with company match
Profit-Sharing/ Defined Contribution (1-year waiting period)
Company-paid ST and LT Disability
Maternity Leave/ Parental Leave
Company-paid Term Life/ Accidental Death Insurance


About The Company

Benefits Coordinators Corporation (BCC), is a third-party employee benefits administrator and a national leader in developing new services designed to help our clients run more effective employee benefit programs. We sell a promise to help our clients through life‚Äôs toughest moments. To ensure we keep that promise, we hold ourselves to a set of principles that we believe position our clients and our company for long-term success. Our Guiding Principles are not just words on paper, they are a promise we make to ourselves and our clients.

These principles have become a driving force of our culture and share many common themes with the values of our clients. First, we hire and develop amazing people that have an insatiable desire to succeed, are committed to earning, and thrive on challenges. Secondly, we pride ourselves on serving our clients' best interests through quality service, innovative solutions, and constantly evaluating our performance. Third, we have embraced and are guided by the theme of ‚Äúbetter every day‚Äù constantly pushing ourselves to be better than yesterday. Ultimately, we get more energy from the future we are creating for our people, our clients, and our company than from our past success.

As an organization, we are very optimistic about the future and have incredibly high expectations for our people and our performance. We also understand that our growth is fueled by becoming better, not bigger ‚Äì growth funds investments in new resources to better serve our clients and provide the career opportunities our employees want and deserve. This is why we are a growth company and why we are committed to being better every day.

Title: Junior Business Support Analyst
Description:
Advanced Construction Robotics in Allison Park, PA is looking to hire a full-time Junior Business Support Analyst. Do you have strong interpersonal and customer service skills with the ability to speak professionally with a wide range of personnel? Would you like an exciting robotics career in the construction industry? If so, please read on!

This position earns a competitive wage. We provide excellent benefits, including medical, dental, vision, paid time off (PTO), paid holidays, a 401(k) with company match, an employer-contributed health savings account (HSA), and profit-sharing. If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, apply today!

Junior Business Support Analyst Responsibilities

Supply Chain Support


Assist with purchasing activities, including order placement and tracking.
Monitor order status and ensure timely delivery from vendors.
Communicate with suppliers regarding lead times, product availability, and order issues.
Analyze supply chain data to identify trends, improve efficiency, and support decision-making.


Customer Service


Support contract creation and ensure accurate documentation of terms and conditions.
Communicate with customers regarding order status, service inquiries, and issue resolution.
Provide accounts receivable (AR) support by coordinating invoice follow-up and customer payment tracking.


Administrative Support


Perform general administrative duties, including document preparation, data entry, and recordkeeping.
Maintain accurate records of purchase orders, invoices, contracts, and shipping documentation.
Assist with scheduling meetings, preparing agendas, and recording meeting notes.
Support internal teams with document management and ad hoc administrative tasks.


Required Skills & Abilities


Excellent organizational and time management skills
Clear written and verbal communication
Attention to detail and ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint)


Education & Experience


Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Operations, or related field.
1+ years of experience in supply chain, operations, or administrative support is a plus.


About Advanced Construction Robotics, Inc.

ACR is a world-leading innovator of autonomous robotic equipment. We have transformed the construction industry by manufacturing and commercializing a wide range of job site robots that enhance productivity, improve safety, reduce schedule risk, and increase profitability. Our technology has been internationally recognized through awards and significant media coverage. We won the first-ever Associated General Contractors of America's Innovation Award. We strive to be the best robot development and commercialization company focused on construction.

Our world-class engineers are some of the best in the business and have previously designed over 50 different robotics systems. We are unique in that we have a very successful and seasoned founder who owns a large heavy-civil construction company and all its related supporting companies. This provides us with quick feedback on initial product design as well as on-the-job testing of both our prototypes and commercialized products. We are dedicated to producing the best products, and to achieve that, we show our dedication to our employees as well.

Safety

This is a Safety Sensitive Position requiring work in an equipment testing facility with various safety hazards which are potentially life-threatening to the employee and Team Members without proper safety precautions. This position may require you to be around heavy equipment and under constantly changing circumstances. Team Members will be subject to more stringent drug testing and compliance policies due to these safety risks.

READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

Are you detail-oriented? Do you have excellent problem-solving and analytical thinking skills? Is working as part of a team something you enjoy?!

We understand your time is valuable, so we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this Junior Business Support Analyst job, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application. We look forward to meeting you!

Special Note

This job description is presented as guidance only. Other reasonable tasks or responsibilities as management sees necessary may be added to this job description in order to achieve satisfactory job performance by the team member.

EEO Statement

Brayman and Affiliate Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or on any other characteristic protected by law.

Confidentiality

Some positions with the company will have access to confidential and proprietary information. Successful candidates for those positions will be required to sign our standard confidentiality agreement as a condition of employment.

Title: Database Administrator
Description:
Sr. Database Administrator / Engineer (PostgreSQL / MySQL)

Company: Located in a northern suburb of Pittsburgh, this company is theindustry leader in providing 100% onshore data infrastructure managed service, offering remote Database and Cloud Infrastructure Management, specializing in Oracle, Microsoft, and open source technologies. Through their strategic tech partnerships, highly specialized teams and platform-agnostic approach, they empower companies worldwide to transform their business with the power of data, analytics and the cloud.

What You Will Do: The Senior Open-Source Database Administrator will lead the deployment, administration, and optimization of open-source database platforms, especially PostgreSQL, MySQL, as well as MongoDB and MariaDB

How You Will Contribute

Provide database management , including installation, configuration, and maintenance of open-source databases to ensure high availability, reliability, and performance.

Manage and optimize cloud-hosted databases (OCI, AWS, Azure) and lead migrations from on-premises to cloud or cloud-to-cloud transitions.

Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks, optimize queries, and ensure database efficiency.

Implement and enforce database security policies, encryption, and access controls to safeguard sensitive data.

Develop and maintain robust backup and disaster recovery strategies.

Work closely with cross-functional teams to support database needs and best practices.

Leverage automation tools, Ansible, Terraform, Bash, or Python, to streamline database operations.

Maintain comprehensive documentation of database configurations, procedures, and best practices.

Requirements

Ideal Candidate: Extensive experience managing PostgreSQL and MySQL databases on-premises and in cloud environments such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), or Microsoft Azure, with a focus on security, performance, and scalability.

What You Bring

8+ years of database administration experience with PostgreSQL and 3+ years MySQL, MongoDB or MariaDB.

In-depth PostgreSQL experience at the enterprise level and experience with Postgres in AWS

Expertise in cloud-based database management (OCI, AWS, Azure). (3+ years of work in AWS)

Strong Linux administration skills for managing database servers.

Proficiency in SQL performance tuning, query optimization, and index strategies.

Adept at implementing high-availability solutions, including clustering and replication.

Strong analytical and troubleshooting skills for diagnosing root cause of issues.

Experience providing on-call support for mission-critical systems.

Familiarity with DevOps and CI/CD pipelines for database integration.

Strong written and verbal English communication skills.

Present as confident, engaging and able to drive the conversation.

Must be able and willing to work shift schedules, including on-call.

It‚Äôs a PLUS If You Also Have

Experience working with BI, ETL or Data Warehouse tools such as Qlik, Redshift, Snowflake, Databricks, etc.

Experience automating database deployments or maintenance using Ansible, Terraform, or Kubernetes.

Certifications in OCI, AWS, Azure, or database technologies.

Experience migrating Oracle databases to PostgreSQL.

Benefits

What You Get:

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, including 401(k) match

Hybrid work environment (1-2x/wk in office) with growth opportunities in a rapidly evolving industry.

Professional development and certification support.

Work with cutting-edge database and cloud-based technologies.

Collaborative culture with a focus on innovation and automation.

Title: Data Managers
Description:
NSABP Foundation, Inc. seeks Data Manager in Pittsburgh, PA

Duties


Serve as the primary internal and Sponsor contact for Data Management questions, issues, or concerns, including data collection, data cleaning, data delivery, data reconciliation, and database lock data management activity timeliness.
Responsible for Data Management Development, including define study requirements; participate in protocol specific EDC and database development; Design, develop and modify data infrastructure to accelerate the processes of data analysis and reporting, evaluate the design, selection and implementation of database changes by comparing them with business requirements and design documents; define standard edit checks and update as needed; develop Query Guidelines; and collaborate with internal teams to develop study setup requirements.
Assist with the development, review and finalization of data transfer requirements.
Serve as primary point of contact for query management, including establish a query dashboard to track performance; routinely review query dashboard to identify and analyze trends; collaborate with internal and external teams to resolve queries; resolve Sponsor or Site reported issues; create and review Data Archives for Sponsors and Sites; and ensure data management files are up-to-date and comprehensive, including data management plans, file specifications, data correction forms and requests, client emails.
Act as primary host for data management inspections and partner audits, and guides inspection readiness activities at clinical trial sites.
Develop and maintain data management plans, audit plans, risk assessments, corrective and preventive action plan.
Direct and perform audits and data verification to assess compliance with clinical trial standard operating procedures, FDA regulations, ICH guidelines and other regulatory bodies.


Telecommuting permitted 2 days per week within the MSA.

Requirements

Position requires a Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Informatics or a related field, plus 3 years of experience in a related role.

This role requires 3 years of experience with the following:


Research experience working with industry clinical trials.
Understanding of modern databases and information technologies.
Metadata Rave, Marvin or REDCap.
Regulatory standards, FDA and GCP for industry trials.
Protocol specific EDC and database development.
Training with the various clinical trial databases used for data collection.


40 hours/week. Must also have authority to work permanently in the U.S. Applicants who are interested in this position may apply at https://www.jobpostingtoday.com/ Ref # **48875**

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre VIVID! - We offer a vibrant, friendly, inclusive culture that supports, develops, and attracts the best people!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

‚ÄØ

We‚Äôre transforming our business and transitioning our technology from an on-premise housing management platform to Microsoft Dynamics.

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Business Analyst work on our transformation programme. This is a‚ÄØfull-time, permanent position working‚ÄØ37 hours‚ÄØper week, with a minimum of 20% of this to be office-based to promote collaboration and team working.

Want to know what we can offer you?‚ÄØ


26 days holiday (plus bank holidays), with the opportunity to buy or sell annual leave
A productivity-related bonus scheme to enhance your take-home
A generous contributory pension of 6%. We‚Äôll match employee contributions between 7% and 10%
Life assurance paid at x 3 annual salary
Private medical insurance
Health care cash plan called Medicash
Enhanced pay for maternity, paternity, adoption and shared parental leave
Access to counselling, legal and financial information
Electric car scheme
Huge variety of in-house & e-learning courses and a range of coaching and mentoring programmes


‚ÄØ‚ÄØ

Here‚Äôs the facts about the role:‚ÄØ

As a Senior Business Analyst, you‚Äôll be a key player in the transformation of VIVID. Your expertise in business processes, requirements gathering, and process improvements will be essential. You‚Äôll assist Programme and Project Managers in the development of their plans, ensuring appropriate tasks are identified and realistic resource estimates are incorporated.

Working initially within our Programme team you‚Äôll work with the business to understand requirements and shape the To-Be Process for Income and Debt Recovery, Tenancy Management, Neighbourhoods and Asset Management on a MS Dynamics platform. You will be part of a team of Business Analysts liaising with business stakeholders, partners, and internal teams. Additionally, you‚Äôll contribute to the development of our business analysis practice, sharing your expertise with the team, with the opportunity to manage small teams from time to time.

As Senior Business Analyst, you‚Äôll have experience leading/mentoring a team of Business Analyst on larger programmes/projects with a good understanding of the concepts and features of MS Dynamic.

The Senior Business Analyst will have a detailed understanding of analysis methods particularly Agile based, creating EPIC, Features and User-Stories, while supporting in activities such as refinements and playbacks. You'll also have a good understanding of Project Management methods, with tools such as Gantt charts, risks and issues logs, and business cases.

Please see attached JD for more information on the requirements and person specification.

Title: Team Player
Description:
As Bar & Waiting Staff, you‚Äôll be key to creating unforgettable moments for customers, whether you‚Äôre pouring a pint or recommending the perfect drink to a customer after a long day, you‚Äôll keep the good times flowing. You‚Äôll be joining a fun and inclusive team, where you can grow and strengthen your skills and experience.

Company Description

Join us at Greene King pubs, where we have always been the beacon for communities, wherever people want to come together. Our collection of community pubs are the heart and soul of the local area around them, helmed by a local hero and crewed by a team always ready with your favourite tipple. Our pubs embody the true meaning of a local pub, acting as a central hub where locals can enjoy one of our events, a feast of lovingly cooked food or a quick catch up with friends over a drink.

Additional Information

We‚Äôre all about rewarding our team‚Äôs hard work, that‚Äôs why‚Ä¶

You‚Äôll receive a competitive salary, pension contribution as well as:


The chance to further your career across our well-known brands ‚Äì as one of the industry's top apprenticeship providers, we can provide training and development at each level of your career.
Discount of 33% for you and 15% for your loved ones on all of our brands ‚Äì so you enjoy your favourite food and drink at a discount.
Free employee assistance program ‚Äì mental health, well-being, financial, and legal support because you matter!
Discount of 50% for you and 25% for your loved ones at our Greene King Inns and hotels ‚Äì so you can enjoy a weekend away without breaking the bank.
Refer a friend ‚Äì who do you know who could be interested in a new role? When they are placed, you could earn up to ¬£1,500 for referring them!
Wagestream ‚Äì access your wage before payday for when life happens.
Retail discounts ‚Äì Receive up to 30% off at Superdrug, exclusive discounts with Three Mobile along with many more‚Ä¶


Qualifications

As a member of our Bar & Waiting Staff, you will‚Ä¶


Provide customers with a heartfelt and memorable experience each and every time they visit.
Be the insider behind the bar, offering recommendations to customers.
Prepare and present drinks that meet specifications and customer expectations.
Assist in greeting, serving food and looking after our customers whilst they dine with us.
Make sure the bar is always safe, legal, and clean, and any issues are dealt with as quickly and safely as possible.


What You‚Äôll Bring‚Ä¶


Willingness to learn and expand your skills.
Have a great eye for detail, making sure every pint is poured to perfection.
A passion for giving great service and making sure every customer receives a warm welcome.
A positive can-do attitude and be a real team player.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$121,100 - C$221,900. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.
Show more
HTML:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements

  • 2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python
  • Strong statistical knowledge
  • Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
  • Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
  • Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
  • Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.


Preferred Qualifications

  • Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
  • Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
  • Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
  • Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.


Hybrid work at Stripe

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$121,100 - C$221,900. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Location: Toronto | Job Type: Full-Time | Experience: 6 months ‚Äì 1 year

About The Role

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst to join our growing team in the advertising industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong foundation in data handling and a curiosity for uncovering insights that drive business decisions. While prior experience in advertising is a plus, it‚Äôs not required ‚Äî we welcome candidates from diverse industry backgrounds who are eager to learn and grow.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in collecting, cleaning, and organizing large datasets from various sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis and identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support campaign performance analysis and regular reporting tasks.
Collaborate with internal teams to understand data needs and deliver insights.
Help maintain documentation for data processes and definitions.


Required Qualifications


6 months to 1 year of hands-on experience working with data in any industry.
Proficiency in Excel/Google Sheets for data analysis.
Basic knowledge of SQL or any data querying language.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Good communication skills and ability to explain data findings to non-technical stakeholders.


Nice to Have


Exposure to marketing or advertising data (e.g., campaign metrics, media performance).
Understanding of digital media platforms (e.g., Google Ads, Meta, DSPs).
Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


Why Join Us


Opportunity to work in a dynamic, creative industry with a data-driven focus.
Learn from experienced analysts and marketers.
Access to real-world advertising datasets and tools.
Career development support and training opportunities.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Permanent Full Time

Canada Life is seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst to join the Insurance Solutions team. As an important part of the Performance Measurement area, this role will be responsible for supporting the data management, analysis, and reporting needs of the department. The Data Analyst supports decision making, monitors business performance, and provides actionable insights using analytics and visualizations geared to the audience.

The role will benefit from collaboration with actuaries, accountants, subject matter experts, and data scientists. If you are looking to become a subject matter expert on connected data and help guide the team in improving processes through data mining and analysis, this is the role for you.

What You Will Do


Build, implement and maintain data models, custom reports, and dashboards, keeping in mind the needs of varied audiences
Create presentations that are visually appealing and use strong communication skills to present to groups
Identify opportunities to ingest data, prioritize data needs, and build data marts to drive efficiencies in reporting functions
Leverage data expertise to support new initiatives through analysis and ongoing reporting throughout the entire analytics lifecycle
Collaborate with cross functional teams to gather requirements and deliver data solutions that meets business requirements
Support existing data owners in their data management practices ensuring a single source of truth
Work with large datasets that are not consistent, clean, or fully modelled
Ensure best practices are followed with respect to data governance and structure
Communicate effectively and demonstrate critical thinking and business acumen


What You Will Bring


2+ years of relevant experience and a university or college degree in a related field of study, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets
Proficiency in Excel, Power BI, Data Modelling, Power Query, DAX, and Databricks, with experience creating interactive dashboards
Capable of working with diverse data inputs and building a data mart that aligns with business requirements
Proven ability to learn quickly and independently and handle multiple priorities in a challenging work environment
Ability to work with little, to no documentation or instructions
Demonstrated attention to detail - Able to produce high quality output under strict and accelerated timelines
Driven to improve - the organization, processes, service performance, efficiency, etc.
Knowledge of our organization, distribution channels, products, systems, and data is an asset
Ability to write complex SQL queries to extract and integrate data from multiple data sources
Proficiency in scripting languages like Python or R
Hands-on experience with Azure compute services and a good understanding of how Azure Data Factory pipelines work (nice to have)


Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: London and Toronto.

The base salary for this position is between $55,700 - $97,700 annually. This represents base salary only and does not represent other variable compensation components of our total compensation ( i.e. annual bonus, commission etc). If you are selected to move forward in our recruitment process, your recruiter will be able to discuss additional details of our total rewards program with you.

Career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting, closing dates will vary depending on the search activity. All applications received will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today!

Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.

You can be your best here. You‚Äôre part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.

Together, as part of a great team, you‚Äôll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It‚Äôs our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that‚Äôs trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.

Canada Life serves‚ÄØthe financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we‚Äôre one of Canada‚Äôs leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.‚ÄØ

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee‚ÄØhas the opportunity to‚ÄØreach their potential.‚ÄØ

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Canada Life policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact talentacquisitioncanada@canadalife.com.

Canada Life‚ÄØwould like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.
